characters: THROUGH A SERIES OF CAR DRIVER'S SIDE WINDOWS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late. Quiet. Run-down neighborhood. A stolen Suburban idles near a Check Cashing store, lights on but gates dow closed for business. PAN the Suburban’s bumper-sticker: “ Child Was Student of the Month at Garden City Middle Scho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The occupants: five African-American males and a Guest. In the driver’s seat is KERYL, 23. Next to him sits ROMEO 18, who tokes on a huge spliff, a Glock .9mm in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: C‘mon, lemme get that shit. Romeo passes the joint to BAMA, 23, Southern accent, who holds another .9mm -- In the back, MARCUS, their 25 year old leader, holds an Uzi. In between him and TYRELL, 22, sits RODRIGO, a trembling Colombian about 30.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: {to Rodrigo) One more time I’ma run this down. We gettin’ out this car, we gonna walk to that side door. You gonna knock the code, you ain't gonna say a motherfuckin’ word. Comprende?

dialogues.speaker: RODRIGO
dialogues.text: Si. Yes. Please no shoot me.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 2.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: That’s up to you, motherfucker. Marcus presses the Uzi against Rodrigo’s temple, leans in

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Try any shit I’1l paint that store with your fuckin’ brains. (then; to the others) Let's do this. As they all pull ski masks down over their faces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chain-smoking KOREAN MAN, 50s, sits at a table, countin Machine WHIRRING as it spits out stacks of HUNDRED DOLLAR BILLS. Nearby, two KOREAN WOMEN tie the stacks with bands Across the room, a Colombian GUARD watches a Tony Robbins infomercial on TV. A few beats, then a coded knock on the side door. RAP. RAP. RAP-RAP-RAP. The Guard approaches th peephole, his .45 pistol still in its holster. GUARD'S POV THROUGH PEEPHOLE - Rodrigo stands outside, ho up a Nathan’s bag. As he unlocks the door...

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Fuck you been, I‘m starvin’ in-- BAMMMM!!! The door kicks in violently, knocking the Guard backward nearly off his feet. The Korean Women SCREAM, throwing up their hands as Marcus & Co. pile in.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ move I‘ll blow your fuckin’ heads off! In a flash, Bama is on the Guard, .9mm jammed in his eye. He quickly takes the .45, forces the guy to his stomach a Tyrell shoves Rodrigo to the floor next to him. While Romeo covers the Women, Marcus produces a nylon duf bag. Workmanlike as the Grinch, but ten times faster, he fills it with the cash. As he loads the money:

dialogues.speaker: KOREAN MAN
dialogues.text: Goddamn cocksucker!

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up!  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 3. At the table, Marcus cleans out the counting machine, sho the bills into the duffel bag. Bama nudges the Korean Man

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: Where the rest at?

dialogues.speaker: KOREAN MAN
dialogues.text: That all, no more!

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: (glancing at his watch) Sixty seconds!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: A-ight, we done.

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: Fuck‘s the rest of the money?!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: We got what we need, let’s go!

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: Lemme grabs the Lottos.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I said let’s-- Just then, another Colombian GUARD appears in the front doorway, raises a sawed-off shotgun... KA-BLAMMM! ! ! A huge hole is blown in the wall inches fr Bama's head. With the Women screaming, Bama holds his shattered eardrum as Marcus sprays the Uzi at the Guard, taking him out. Marcus shoves the duffel into Romeo's han

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Gol! Got! As Romeo bolts off, Tyrell covers the room while Marcus g Bama, carrying him out the door with one arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In panic mode, Romeo sprints to the Suburban, tosses the duffel in. Marcus rushes up holding Bama, Tyrell followin

dialogues.speaker: KERYL MARCUS
dialogues.text: Fuck happened in there?! Help me get him in! Romeo and Tyrell help Marcus lift Bama, pile in after him  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 4,

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Drive!! Gol! Gol! As they screech off, SIRENS blare in the distance and we. cuT TO: A CHERRY TOP LIGHT -- spinning wildly, flashing in the da The CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal it’s on an AMBULANCE that screeches down the Van Wyck Expressway. On screen appears 1976

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I was born in 1976, same year as the Bicentennial. Laying on the gurney is KATRINA, 15, pretty, African-Amer and very pregnant; she moans loudly, in full labor. Her MOTHER, 40s, holds her hand as a PARAMEDIC checks her vit

dialogues.speaker: KATRINA
dialogues.text: It hurts! Ohhh! Motherfucker!!

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: I did it nine times, baby, I know. And as Katrina continues moaning...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The little girl on the gurney’s my moms. She‘s fifteen years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cramped room; Stevie Wonder & Charlie’s Angels (the TV show) posters on the wall, clothes everywhere. With her three SISTERS asleep nearby, Katrina lays awake, staring a mirrored disco ball hanging from the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I never knew for sure who my pops was - she never really talked about him at all. She always told me I was the immaculate conception.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 5. Suddenly the disco ball starts glowing; a bright, other- worldy light fills the room, reflecting off Stevie Wonder sunglasses. It washes down over Charlie's Angels, alighti Katrina’s face as she sits up in bed.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I guess I liked that better than the truth, which was probably that he was some no-account nigga from the hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katrina, now 19, scoops meat into a row of taco shells.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It didn’t really matter anyway - with my moms around, I didn‘t need no dad. See most girls her age woulda gone on welfare, let the government pay their ass, but Katrina Philips wasn‘t about that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katrina punches her time card, opens her pay envelope, glances at the check - $89.00. She frowns slightly.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: She assessed her options, tradin’ fast food for fast money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katrina, 22 and blinged-out, leans into a Monte Carlo ful white COLLEGE GUYS. The DRIVER hands her a $20; she slips him a foil packet of coke. As he pulls away, Katrina head back to her spot on the corner, sips a Sprite. Further up the block, a hard-looking hustler we’ll come to know as TOPCAT, 28, gives her a subtle nod.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Time she was twenty two, she had her own house and a brand new Buick Regal -- for me, every day was Christmas with my moms.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 6. EXT. TOYS ‘R US - PARKING LOT - DAY Marcus, now 8 and wearing a thick gold chain, running sui and bright white sneakers, holds an armload of toys as he follows Katrina toward a a shiny black ‘84 Buick Regal.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Can we go to Carvel?

dialogues.speaker: KATRINA
dialogues.text: (checks her beeper) I gotta make a stop first, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With rap music on the radio, the Regal sits parked at the curb, Marcus in the passenger seat playing with a “Mr. T” A-Team action figure. Nearby, Katrina stands arguing with SLIM, rail thin, Geri-curled, 20s. Topcat, the hustler we met earlier, mediates.

dialogues.speaker: KATRINA
dialogues.text: Nine times I told this motherfucker stay on his side the boulevard!

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: You own this fuckin’ street? Opportunity knocks, I take the sale, bitch.

dialogues.speaker: KATRINA
dialogues.text: {lunges at him) Who you call bitch, motherfucker?! Katrina slaps and scratches at Slim; he tries to fight ba

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT SLIM
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa! Don’t push me, girl - I will fuckin’ beat your ass! Topcat separates the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Chill now, fuck you doin'?! You don‘t do that shit out here!

dialogues.speaker: KATRINA
dialogues.text: Lionel Richie-lookin’ motherfucker. Topcat gives them hard looks. Things calm down, then:  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 7.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Here’s how it’s gonna be. Trina works the south side of Brewer and you stay the fuck ‘cross the street.

dialogues.speaker: SLIM
dialogues.text: Bitch be pickin’ my pocket.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: (reaching for his gun) Fuck I just say motherfucker? Topeat stares him down, ice-cold eyes. A few beats, then:

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Now get your bony ass back there. Slim shoots Katrina a look, then crosses the street.

dialogues.speaker: KATRINA
dialogues.text: Pussy ass nigga.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Take it easy. Everybody gonna eat. Topeat looks over, notices Marcus sitting in the car. He crosses to him, leans inside, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Hey lil’ homey, who you got there?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Mr. T.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Mr. T?! I ever tell you ‘bout the time I whupped his ass?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You buggin’. Mr. T is bad. Topcat smiles, pats Marcus’ head as Katrina gets in the c

dialogues.speaker: KATRINA
dialogues.text: I’m droppin’ him off, I’1l be back later.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Time‘s money, Trina.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 8. Topcat crosses off. Katrina settles in. Marcus is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: KATRINA
dialogues.text: Y'all right baby boy?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Why was you fightin’ with that man?

dialogues.speaker: KATRINA
dialogues.text: Who, Slim? He was tryin’ to take somethin’ belonged to me baby, and you can’t let people do that. You gotta be strong.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I don’t like when people fight.

dialogues.speaker: KATRINA
dialogues.text: What you worried about? Don’t you know I‘d never let nothin’ happen to you? Look at me, baby. (off his look) I will always protect you.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: KATRINA
dialogues.text: C'mon now, let’s get some Carvel. INT. GRANDMA‘S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Now in pj‘s, Marcus sits on the couch eating Carvel ice c with six other BOYS and GIRLS ranging from age 12 to 25.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Though Katrina had her own crib, a lot of time I stayed with my grandparents and my eight aunts and uncles -- shit, some of them niggas weren‘t much older than me. UNCLE SPORT, 17, and GRANDPA attempt to hook up a new VCR

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE SPORT
dialogues.text: You plugged it in output. You gotta use input.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: Shut your ig‘nant mouth ‘for I input my boot up your ass.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 9. The CAMERA DRIFTS to THE FOYER, where Katrina and Marcus’ Grandma, now 50s, are in the midst of a hushed argument.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA
dialogues.text: He don’t need your money, Katrina, he needs you.

dialogues.speaker: KATRINA
dialogues.text: He got me. I’m here, ain‘t I?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA
dialogues.text: And when you go get yourself in jail, then what?

dialogues.speaker: KATRINA
dialogues.text: I ain't goin’ to jail, will you stop sweatin’ my ass?

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA
dialogues.text: Don‘t you use that lang--~ Katrina looks, noticing something. Grandma turns to see w it is ~ Marcus is watching them. They trade looks. A truc

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA
dialogues.text: Marcus, say goodbye to your mama. Marcus approaches. Katrina kneels down, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: KATRINA
dialogues.text: I'll see you Saturday, okay, baby?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Can we get the Atari?

dialogues.speaker: KATRINA
dialogues.text: I told you we could, didn't I? (off Marcus’ smile) Now gimme a kiss. Marcus kisses his mother; she hugs him, exits. EXT. KATRINA‘’S HOUSE ~ LONG ISLAND - NIGHT Late. Katrina pulls the Regal into the driveway of a neat ranch style home on a quiet suburban street.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Turned out I never did get that Atari -- Katrina didn’t show up that Saturday.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 10. INT. KATRINA‘S HOUSE - LONG ISLAND - NIGHT Katrina enters the foyer, flips on the light. And as soon she closes the door... SLIM APPEARS from behind it, slipping an electrical cord around her throat. Knee in her back, he YANKS violently o the cord, lifting her off her feet. Katrina flails wildly kicking, scratching, eyes bulging. Slim tightens his grip

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That was the day they found her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few KIDS on bicycles look on as two UNIFORMED MEN from Coroner's office remove Katrina‘s corpse in a body bag.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Just like that, my mom’s life ended. Life as I knew it ended too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near a meager Christmas tree, the family sits around in r and pj's, looking on as Marcus unwraps a few simple prese

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: With my grandpa on disability and eight other kids to feed, shit like Atari was a thing of the past. Marcus opens a gift - a bag of small green plastic Army M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bookbag over his shoulder, Marcus walks to school past boarded-up storefronts; garbage, broken glass everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: In addition to me, that summer there was another new arrival in Queens -- crack swept through like a hurricane. Some folks said it was the worst thing ever happened to the hood...  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 11. SIRENS in the distance, Marcus side-steps a filthy, pregn CRACK HO, who stands with a few other emaciated FIENDS.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Some said it was the best. A HUSTLER drives by in a gleaming ‘85 Bonneville, drippin with gold jewelry as rap music BLARES from his stereo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BELL rings; KIDS pour out of the graffiti-covered sch including Marcus and CAMERON, a skinny kid in glasses abo his own age. In contrast to Marcus’ hand-me-downs, Camero is well dressed, wearing a brand new Starter jacket.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: ...then Rambo grabs the Chinese dude and hits him like pow!!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Who, the first dude? Across the street, some older KIDS hang out smoking, boom cranked. Their ringleader, KENNETH, a scary-looking, ligh skinned, redheaded bully about 13 spots Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Yo, yo, Cameron. Hold up!

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON MARCUS
dialogues.text: (nervous ) (to Cameron) Nah man, I gotta go home. Who that?

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: Yo, lemme holla at you a second!

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Run Marcus! Marcus and Cameron take off running. Kenneth starts chasi them, but can’t dodge the traffic to cross the street.

dialogues.speaker: KENNETH
dialogues.text: I catch you little nigga that jacket is mine! EXT. GRANDMA’S HOUSE - STREET - DUSK Marcus and Cameron sit quietly on the curb, carving their names in the blacktop with nails.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 12.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: You ever think about your moms?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I dunno, sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Shit's messed up. Marcus half-shrugs. A few beats, then:

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Wanna play skelly?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Okay, lemme get my cap. They stand. Just then, the street lights come on.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Aww, man.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Cameron was a rarity in the hood, a kid with somethin‘ almost no other kid had - a moms and a dad. Across the street, CAMERON’S FATHER, 35, pokes his head o of the screen door of a small, neatly-kept house.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON'S FATHER
dialogues.text: Cameron!

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: I know. See you tomorrow, Marcus. Marcus watches as Cameron crosses the street and goes ins

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Every night when that street light came on, it was time for Cameron to go in. I hated that fuckin’ light. EXT. GRANDMA’S HOUSE - STREET - NIGHT Marcus stands alone in the deserted street, throwing rock the street light’s bulb. After a few tries with no succes he sits, takes a small plastic Soldier from his pocket. H plays with it a bit, then after a while starts talking to  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 13.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What ‘chu worried about, man? You gotta be tough. Don‘t you know I’1l always protect you? Marcus sits alone, the sound of SIRENS in the distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the garbage-strewn schoolyard, rap music plays from a nearby boom box. Marcus looks on with a few other KIDS as a GIRL break-dances on a piece of cardboard.

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Pop-lock like you did before! That shit crazy. Just then, outside the fence, a commotion. Marcus looks, sees Cameron surrounded by the bully Kenneth and his boys

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Oh snap, Cameron in trouble now. As Kenneth tries to yank off Cameron’s jacket, Marcus rea in his pocket. He squeezes the plastic Soldier, then purposefully strides across the schoolyard onto the stree

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Where you goin’, Marcus?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Growin’ up in the hood it’s a constant battle to get nice things. Barely missing a step, Marcus grabs a loose six-inch piec of concrete from the sidewalk around a tree.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's a bigger battle to keep ‘em. Marcus approaches Kenneth, whose back is to him as he rou yanks off Cameron‘s starter jacket.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Hey! Kenneth turns and... WHAMMMM!! Marcus SMASHES him across the face with the concrete. A gash immediately opens over Kenneth’s eye, blood pouring down his shirt as he goes do

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Touch him again I will fuck your ass up! All you motherfuckers!  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 14. Kenneth crawls to his feet, runs off. His gang suddenly g very quiet. Marcus stares them down - no one has the ball to challenge him. He leads Cameron back to the schoolyard

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Over the next few years, I made a reputation for myself with the other kids. And in the hood, reputation is the cornerstone of power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, now 12, walks down the street. He stops to look i the window of “Value World Shoes”, where a sharp-looking of Adidas’ is on display with a price tag of $75.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The problem with a reputation’s you gotta live up to it. And it's hard lookin’ fly wearin’ Pro fuckin' Keds. Marcus looks down at his own ratty sneakers and heads off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dejected Marcus walks down the street, which is dotted with crack HUSTLERS and FIENDS. On the corner, looking like a million bucks, Topcat leans on his ‘88 Caddy Sevil smooth-talking a neighborhood HOTTIE. As Marcus passes by

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Yo, how you doin’, b.g.?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I’m a-ight. As the Hottie crosses off, Marcus approaches Topcat.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Look at you, all growed up. So what's happenin’, brother?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I dunno. Goin’ to school.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Educate thyself, your mama‘d be proud. So you need anything?  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 1s.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Nah.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Ah, see now you lyin’ to Topcat. Everybody need somethin’.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: {shrugs; shy) Tryin’ to hold some Adidas’.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Sneakers, that all? Shit, I’ll have you rockin’ sneakers and some new gear. EXT. QUEEN’S PLAZA MALL - DAY With Marcus in the passenger seat, Topcat pulls the Sevil into the mall parking lot, rap music thumping.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: There’s two sure ways to get a kid to do somethin’. Take away what they already have or give ‘em somethin’ they want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a shoe store, Marcus tries on new Adidas’; Topcat pays cash from a thick wad. Another store; Marcus picks out a Starter jacket, matching hat. In a jewelry store, Marcus reluctantly picks out a gold chain; Topcat nods it's okay

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: You wanna make friends, givin' somethin’ they want works a whole lot better. INT. MCDONALD’S - DAY Nearly empty. Eating a Big Mac, wearing his new clothes, Marcus sits across from Topcat, who smokes, but doesn’t e

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Tell you man, your moms? That there was a special lady. And smart? Shit. She loved your ass too, you know.  Untitled 50 Cent Project and Revision 09/12/04 16.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: (a few beats; then) Like your new threads?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You trippin’? They great.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Tell you what... nah, forget it.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Nah, you too young.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: No I ain’t, what? Topeat feigns that he’s thinking it over, then “caves”.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: A-ight, but only cause your moms was a friend of mine. Instead of you askin’ for fish, how you’d like if I give you a pole instead? (off Marcus’ confusion) What I'm sayin’ is how'd you like to be able to buy all this shit yourself. Matter fact, how you'd like to be able to buy anything you want?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Shit yeah. Topcat looks around, then leans in.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Here’s the thing then, man to man. You know what crack is, right? (off Marcus’ nod) Well you should never ever do that shit, it fucks you all up. But long as there’s other niggas stupid enough to do it, why not turn that to your advantage? (looks around; pulls out a vial) See this little shit? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 17. TOPCAT (cont'd) You can stand on Brewer thirty seconds, sell it to a fiend for ten dollar.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Ten dollar for that?

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Tell you what else. He got the paper, that same fiend gonna come back in two hours buy another.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: (smiles; then) A-ight, here’s I’ma do, I'ma hook you up, give you a tryout.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: {holds up vial) We go back to Brewer, I‘ma give you five of these. Every four you pump for me, you pump one for yourself, keep the money. That’s a ten dollar profit.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: This a big opportunity little man, you sure you can handle it?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Hell yeah. And as Marcus and Topcat shake hands, we FREEZE FRAME:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: From that moment, I was addicted to crack. Not doin’ it -- sellin’ it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Topcat looks on from down the block, 12-year-old Marcu stands amidst a few other Hustlers ranging from age 16 to

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Every afternoon from three to six I was out on the street.  untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 18, A gypsy CAB pulls up; the PASSENGER waves Marcus over. He approaches, trades crack for cash; the Cab pulls off. INT. GRANDMA’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - DAY CLOSE ON A CLOCK - 6:12 p.m. Marcus enters, passing Grand who smiles at him as she makes spaghetti.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I told my grandma I joined some bullshit after-school program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus is on the street; a shaky FIEND, 20s, approaches w a handful of crumpled-up singles.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Most hustlers wouldn't take singles, but me, I‘d take fuckin’ pennies that’s all a fiend had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using a phone book to lean on, Marcus uses a steam iron t neatly press a stack of bills into crisp, flat notes.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I got so obsessed with money I used to iron the bills out, count how much I had over and over and over. INT. BOYS’ BEDROOM - BASEMENT - DAY Marcus sits on the bed, finishes lacing up his old pair o Pro Keds. He grabs his bookbag, exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus enters the kitchen, says goodbye to Grandma, who serves Grandpa waffles at the table.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA
dialogues.text: Got your chess club today, baby?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah, till six.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 19.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: Boy a genius. Marcus exits.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The fucked up thing is for all the green I was holdin’, I couldn‘t let my grandparents know about it. EXT. CAMERON’S HOUSE - BACK YARD - DAY As Cameron acts as look-out, Marcus slips off his Keds, t pulls a Hefty bag out from behind the garage.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Come on Marcus, hurry. From a small selection of brand new pairs of sneakers, Ma removes a pair of snow white Adidas’ from the bag.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I stashed my real sneakers over behind Cameron's garage. And as he starts changing his sneakers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus and a few other Hustlers stand around a boombox, w blares NWA. One of them, a scary, droopy-eyed thug we'll come to know as JUNEBUG, 16, bops his head to the music.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: It was right around this time I first got into rap. I mean once NWA dropped they shit, every nigga I knew was rhymin’.

dialogues.speaker: JUNEBUG
dialogues.text: Yo, you feelin’ this shit?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: For the first time we heard music that truly reflected our lives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus and Cameron make their way down the street, passin Hustler who raps as a few others look on.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 20.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hustlers, fiends, even little kids wanted to be rappers. Me and my friends‘d fuck around in the yard, write our own verses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, Cameron and a few other 5th GRADERS look on as on them, LEONARD, raps to a tired, old-school beat.

dialogues.speaker: LEONARD
dialogues.text: My name is. Leonard and I’m here to say/That I’m the best rapper in the world today...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The difference was I took it serious, actually worked at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same KIDS are gathered near Marcus, who raps to a bea He‘s colorful, clever and very talented, but way too hard for a 5th grader, with lyrics about crack, murder and pus A TEACHER walks by on her way into the school, overhearin Marcus as he raps. And on her appalled expression...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But much as I liked rappin’, it was sort of just a hobby -- nothin’ gave me a rush like makin’ money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, now 15 and wearing new clothes and jewelry, works street. Nearby we see Junebug, now 19, in a tense discuss with a THUG in a Yankee’s cap.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Not that hustlin’ didn’t have its down-side. There was fierce fuckin’ competition. A strung-out WOMAN pulls up in a car; Marcus and two othe Hustlers race to make the sale.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With other Hustlers nearby, Marcus selis to Kenneth, the schoolyard bully, who now has a scar over his eye.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Plus there was always the po-po to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: HUSTLER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Five-0!! Kenneth runs off. Marcus bolts behind a parked car, ducks down as a POLICE CRUISER passes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus sells to a Fiend. Nearby, talking on a pay phone i the THUG in the Yankee’s cap.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But your biggest problem was one you might not even know you had... A rusty Nissan rolls to a stop. As casually as if he's buying a newspaper, Junebug emerges from the back, walks the Thug in the Yankee cap...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Beef with another nigga.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: Junebug empties a Glock into YANKEE CAP‘S body, finishing him off with three head shots. As blood pools on the sidewalk, Junebug locks eyes with Marcus, then jumps back in the Nissan, which screeches off.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: It’s some fucked up shit, but as they say, no risk, no reward. And by the time I was 15, I had more “reward” than I could hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Marcus, Junebug and a few other Hustlers look on from the street, Topcat stands talking to a shifty-looking, go toothed hustler we’ll come to know as ODELL, 27.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 22.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Cash, jewelry, I even had my own Kawasaki I'd ride to school every day. But all that shit was nothin’ compared to what some niggas had. In SLO-MO, a midnight blue Rolls Royce pulls over near To and Odell. From up front step two hard-looking gangstas i their 20s -- MAJESTIC, shaved head, and BREEZE, dreds. Th look around, then open the rear door for LEVAR CAHILL, la 30s, dressed from head to toe in leather and diamonds.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: In the New York coke trade, not even the Colombians were bigger than Levar Cahill. As Majestic and Breeze look on, Levar greets Topcat and Odell, who smiles broadly, flashing his prominent gold te

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Fuck, that nigga was the New York coke trade, the gangsterest nigga there was.

dialogues.speaker: HUSTLER
dialogues.text: Whoa, check that fuckin’ ride.

dialogues.speaker: JUNEBUG
dialogues.text: Rolls ain’t shit. Bentley, that’s my fuckin’ car. Just then, from down the block:

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Marcus! Yo Marcus! Topcat waves Marcus over. He starts over, tentative.

dialogues.speaker: JUNEBUG
dialogues.text: Oooh, look at this nigga. Fresh off the step, now he hangin’ with the big dawgs. Marcus approaches nervously. Levar turns to Topcat.

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: Who this little nigga?

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: You remember Trina, right? (off his confusion) Trina?  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 23.

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: (flash of recognition) Oh yeah, right. Right.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: This here her baby boy.

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: Word? Levar smiles broadly, looks Marcus over approvingly.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Little nigga move more weight than five of these other motherfuckers.

dialogues.speaker: ODELL
dialogues.text: True dat, boy a worker bee. From down the block, Junebug looks on, clearly jealous at attention Marcus is getting from the big man.

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: So you out there grindin’, makin’ me money?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah, I... You like a God to me, Mr. Cahill.

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: (smiling broadly) Like a God? Little nigga I’m God, Buddha and motherfuckin’ Allah rolled into one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus pulls up on his motorcycle, parks it outside.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I went home that night in a daze, I mean meetin’ Levar Cahill was like meetin‘ a movie star, even better. We see a makeshift cardboard license plate as Marcus take his backpack and heads off toward the school entrance.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I still wasn’t thinkin’ straight when I left for school next day.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STUDENTS wait on line to go through a metal detector, pla their bags on a table to be searched. Marcus approaches.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Bag. Marcus hands over his backpack. The GUARD opens it, pulis out a notebook, gym clothes, a pair of hi-tops with rolle socks stuffed inside. He pulls out the socks - and out sp a dozen CRACK VIALS. Marcus looks as shocked as the Guard

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Oh fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a few TEACHERS and STUDENTS look on, a COP leads a handcuffed Marcus to a waiting POLICE CAR.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The truth is I wasn’t sneakin’ that shit inside, I never hustled at school. I had hid it in there weeks ago and forgot all about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, head bowed, stands with his LAWYER before a JUDGE Grandma and Grandpa look on from the spectator section.

dialogues.speaker: LAWYER
dialogues.text: It’s a first offense, your honor, he’s fifteen years old. He was holding it for a friend.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: (thinks a beat; then) He‘ll pay a fine of five hundred dollars and I‘m recommending he be suspended from school for two weeks. And Mr. Philips? (off Marcus’ look) If I ever see you in my courtroom again you will go to jail. Marcus nods, crosses with his Lawyer to his Grandparents.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 25.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I know this sounds twisted, but I blamed gettin’ caught on my grandparents. Way I saw it, if I didn‘t have to hide my shit, this never woulda happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus sits on the couch across from his Grandparents.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: Is that what you wanna be, a damn disgrace?!

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA
dialogues.text: A boy your age, Marcus. And you have such intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA
dialogues.text: What about your future? They keep talking, but we can‘t hear them at all.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: For a kid in the hood, the future’s the shit you see in Star Wars. Shit, most niggas I know catch a bullet way before they’re 30, so what kinda future is that?

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (game show host voice) So here‘s the deal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the set of “Let’s Make a Drug Deal”, Marcus stands wit Topcat, who’s dressed and acts like a cheesy game show Ho

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: You can stand on the corner, hustle crack and have enough money for a Mercedes in six months... Topcat nods toward his lovely game show ASSISTANT, in bik heels and fur as she fawns over a Mercedes 450SL.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 26.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Or you can bust your black ass, go to college for twelve years and Maybe have enough left over for a down payment on a Ford fucking Escort. Topcat gestures to his other ASSISTANT - a fat, middle-ag HOUSEWIFE gesturing to a shitty Ford Escort.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: So what‘s it gonna be Marcus, door number one, the Mercedes, or door number two, the Escort? THE AUDIENCE is packed with YOUNG BLACK MALES.

dialogues.speaker: AUDIENCE MEMBER
dialogues.text: You crazy nigga?! Number One! Get that coochie too! one! BACK TO MARCUS, who stands with Topcat thinking it over.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Not much of a choice, is it? INT. MARCUS’ APARTMENT - BEDROOM - DAY With his back to the camera, wearing a brand new track su Marcus finishes dressing, lacing up his sneakers.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Truth is getting caught did do me gome good. CLOSE ON his hands as he puts on some jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now that it was all in the open, it forced me to decide who I was and who I wanted to be. He clips a beeper on his waist, slips a .380 in his pocke

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: At the end of the day, all things considered... The adult Marcus, 18, turns and looks directly INTO CAMER

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I‘m a fuckin’ hustler, baby.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Softly rapping to himself, Marcus stands at his designate spot on the street, a few other Hustlers up the block. (NOTE: Whenever possible, we should see Marcus rapping to himself out of habit, the way some people hum.)

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: With my purpose in life now clear, I moved out my Grandma‘s and quit school -- now I could be on the street all day. A Toyota Celica pulls over. Marcus runs to it, leans in t window. The driver is a shaky white BUSINESSMAN, 30s.

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: Let me get two purple tops.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Buy four, I give you five. The Businessman nods. Marcus makes the sale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street is crowded with traffic. Marcus makes a sale t FIEND, five others lined up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Fuck, it was busy I’d grind all night, wouldn’t even go home to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn. Marcus, still in the same clothes, dozes on a bench the only hustler on the street. The same white BUSINESSMA pulls up in the Toyota. Marcus makes the sale.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I was master of the fast flip. I’d buy three and a half grams from Topcat... INT. MARCUS’ APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - DAY In boxers and strapless T, Marcus watches “New Jack City” video as he fills purple-topped vials with crack rocks.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 28.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Cook it, bag it up and pump it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus makes a sale to Kenneth, the schoolyard bully, who 21 has become a thin, hollow-eyed crack fiend.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I’d take that money, buy seven grams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Topcat, clearly having been woken up, makes a sale to Mar

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: {yawning) Fuck time is it?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Seven turned to fourteen, fourteen to twenty eight and so on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot. Summer. The street is packed with cars, Hustlers, Fiends and regular PEOPLE just hanging out.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Before long that three and a half grams was like Jack and the Beanstalk. Shit grew so big I had to expand, put together my own crew.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There was Antwan, a sharp-dressin’, ball-breakin’ nigga from Harlem... ANTWAN, slick, well-dressed, 16, leans in the car window.

dialogues.speaker: ANTWAN
dialogues.text: Yo son, you buyin’ or drivin‘ round the block? I know you didn‘t wave me over to suck my dick or did you?  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 29.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Romeo, who'd fuck a Cocker Spaniel it didn’t bite him first... ROMEO, 17, small, horny, leans in the car window.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Hey girl, you fine, you know that? Tell me what ‘chu need baby.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Keryl, a fat little nigga who talked more shit than Don King... KERYL, 16, fat, leans in the car window.

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: Fuck dawg, I got whatever you need. All these other niggas come see me when they need they shit.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Finally there was my boy, Tyrell. TYRELL, 18, muscular, leans in the car window.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: What up yo, how you doin’?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Straight up, dependable, my second in command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus and the Crew stand together looking INTO THE CAMER Each holds a stack of fanned-out CASH in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: This was my dream team - my brothers ~ five niggas dedicated to one thing and one thing only -- gettin’ paid. INT. MARCUS’ APARTMENT - KITCHEN — NIGHT Pouring rain; thunder. In the living room, Romeo channel- surfs, smokes a joint. At the table, Marcus raps to himse as he, Tyrell and Antwan play dominoes for money, drink 4  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 30.

dialogues.speaker: ANTWAN
dialogues.text: C’mon nigga, will you go ‘for mushrooms start growin’ out your ass?

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ strategizin’ here. (beat; then to Marcus) Will you stop fuckin’ singin’ so’s I can think?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (laughing) You either got the bone or you don’t, motherfucker. Tyrell makes his move. Marcus SLAMS down his last domino.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Boo-yah! ! (cackles; grabs money) Strategize my dick you dumb-ass nigga, I knew you was gonna throw that shit!

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: You knew shit, motherfucker. A KNOCK at the door. Marcus crosses, looks out the peepho

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: It‘s me yo, open up. Marcus opens the door. Keryl stands there, soaked from he to toe. The guys SCREAM with laughter as he enters.

dialogues.speaker: ANTWAN
dialogues.text: Look at this Free Willy motherfucker all wet -- I told you he live in the ocean!

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ rainin’ out, motherfucker. Yo, you hear about Levar Cahill? Got his ass arrested, yo.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: What's this fuckin’ mean? The Crew all looks to Marcus.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 31.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What it meant was Levar was goin’ away... but that didn’t mean for a second he wouldn’t still be runnin’ things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under a sign reading “Bon Voyage Levar”, dozens of Hustle and their scantily-clad GIRLFRIENDS board a huge party bo

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The big question was who’d take over his day-to-day -- and my man Topcat seemed like the logical choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The packed boat cruises the Hudson River, the lights of Manhattan glistening behind it. Music, dancing, Cristal flowing, tuxedo-clad WAITERS serving giant shrimp. Off to the side of the dance floor, the camera finds

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS,
dialogues.text: champagne in hand as he takes in the opulence. Nearby, a very sharply-~dressed Topcat nuzzles his GIRLFRIEND’S nec Odeil, the gold-toothed Hustler, talks to some other PLAY

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: (playful; biting her neck) Tonight is the night, baby. Topcat’s GIRLFRIEND giggles. Just then, the Crowd parts. Levar approaches with his bodyguards Majestic and Breeze.

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: (to Topecat; as they hug) Get a room motherfucker. Manhattan ain’t but a quarter mile away.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Yo g, it ain’t too late. You want I‘1l get this motherfucker turn this boat around, drive it straight to motherfuckin’ Africa.

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: And live over there with them jungle niggas? I‘1l do my time.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 32. They all laugh. Levar winks at Marcus, then:

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: Y’all know Majestic, right?

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. What up, b? ‘Sup.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: My nigga Breeze. Breeze just nods. Levar looks over toward the DJ, gesture for him to cut the music. The CROWD groans.

dialogues.speaker: DI
dialogues.text: All right yo, simmer down, our guest of honor wanna holla at you a bit. As the Crowd hoots and hollers, Levar crosses the dance floor, Guests patting his back as he goes. He takes the m

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: Y’all havin’ a good time? {the Crowd screams) What?! All them niggas back in Queens can’t hear y’all! (they scream louder) How ‘bout them niggas in Brooklyn? (they scream even louder) Fuck them Jersey niggas, who give a fuck about them. (the Crowd laughs) On the real though, we all know why we’re here and that’s to say goodbye to my ass.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL IN CROWD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We love you Levar!

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: I love y'all, too. Main thing though’s even though I’m gone, I‘ma always be around in spirit. And just to make sure y‘all don‘t forget that, I‘m appointin’ someone to remind y’all... Marcus looks at Topcat, Odell and the other older Hustler all looking on in anticipation. Topcat breathes in, squee his Girlfriend's hand. Clearly he thinks he’s the one.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 33.

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: Majestic, c’mon up here, son. The Crowd goes WILD as Majestic crosses the dance floor. Topcat and the others do their best to hide their emotion applauding with everyone else, but clearly they’re pissed

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: (into mic) Hey yo, what up, how y’all doin‘? Let‘s give it up for Levar... Marcus looks at Topcat, doing his best to hide his anger. And as Topcat stalks. off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Junebug working down the street, Marcus is in mid-sa to a Fiend as he talks to Tyrell, Antwan and Keryl.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I’m tellin’ you man, there was mad fuckin’ money on that yacht. Diamonds and gold like a fuckin’ pirate ship.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: Word?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Forget about the pussy, yo, there was bitches there was off the fuckin’ hook.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Sign me up for that shit.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: One day we get there, b, we all will long’s we stick together.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: I heard that.

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: I read about some pirate ship crashed right off the harbor there in Brooklyn.

dialogues.speaker: ANTWAN
dialogues.text: Fuck you talkin’ about?  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 34.

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: Back in the day, fuckin’ slave ship filled with jewels and shit.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Probably the one brought your monkey-ass relatives.

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: (off their laughter) Fuck you niggas, one day I‘ma scuba dive, fuckin’ find that shit.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (points across street) Well meantime there‘s a fiend over there wants to give you ten dollar, so whyn’t you go fuckin’ get it?

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: I’m serious yo, they gonna put up a statue of my ass. Marcus shakes his head as Keryl crosses off...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The difference between me and niggas like Keryl is they'd dream about doin’ bigger shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Topcat opens a wall safe, removes a kilo of cocaine.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I’d fuckin’ do it. INT. TOPCAT’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - DAY Topcat enters the living room. Marcus sits on the couch, a paper bag on the coffee table in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: (hands him the kilo) Full bird son, you movin’ up in the world.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: If it ain‘t up, it’s down. {nods to the paper bag) Thirty thousand in there.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 35.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Makin’ my new boss a rich nigga. I need to count this shit?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What you think? Topcat smiles, crosses to a bar. Grabs a bottle of Hennes

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Little Henry?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ ten in the mornin’.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Well excuse me, motherfucker, you plannin’ on flyin’ a airplane? Marcus smiles. Topcat pours half a rocks glass of Henness He downs it, pours another. Sits back on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: So I was thinkin’ after I pump this shit, I’m gonna get me one of them Land Rovers.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Big ride for a little nigga. (smiles; a few beats) You know I’m the one taught your moms how to drive.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Word?

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Parkin’ lot there at the beach, Riis Park. We’d go out there in the winter it was all empty, icy and shit. She’d be skiddin’ that fuckin’ thing all over the place. Marcus smiles. They sit in silence a while, then:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Ever hear what become of that nigga killed her ass?

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Slim? Thought he went down south somewheres, then I heard Cali. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 69/12/04 36. TOPCAT (cont'd) I woulda popped that motherfucker, fed his dick to my dog.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You ever find where he is, you gonna let me know, right?

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Nigga probably dead by now anyway. Topcat sips his Hennessy; his eyes get misty.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: She was a beautiful girl, your moms. A special girl. Marcus looks at him. They sit there in silence. EXT. GUY BREWER BOULEVARD — DAY Marcus, Antwan, Keryl, Tyrell and Romeo work the boulevar selling to Fiends on the street and in cars.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Over the next few weeks, me and my boys was grindin’.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of neighborhood PEOPLE, welfare checks in hand, stretches clear out the door.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Best days were the first and fifteenth when the checks came in. As FIENDS emerge, cash in hand, they join another line ar the corner... the one to buy crack from Marcus and Tyrell

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Not that it was all easy. See when you work the street, it’s jungle rules...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his crew nearby, Marcus stands on a corner. Across t street, a Fiend pulls up in a car, waves him over. But before Marcus can cross, Junebug hustles up, takes the sa  Untitled 50 Cent Project "2nd Revision 09/12/04 37.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And in the jungle, you either fight or get eaten alive. The Fiend pulls off. Marcus approaches Junebug.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Fuck you doin’, that‘s my sale.

dialogues.speaker: JUNEBUG
dialogues.text: Get out my face, nig-- PoW! Marcus punches Junebug in the mouth, knocking him do

dialogues.speaker: JUNEBUG
dialogues.text: {reaching for his gun) Motherfucker! I’ma cap your ass. Marcus kicks him in the face, then jams a .9mm in his che

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: How you gonna do that? You gonna take on all of us? Junebug looks up - Tyrell, Romeo, Keryl and Antwan stand aiming guns at him. Junebug deflates. As Marcus takes his gun and rifles his pockets for money, a BMW pulls to the curb, Breeze driving, Majestic next to him.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: Fuck you doin’?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Nigga took my sale.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: So you robbin' him?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I’m takin’ what’s mine.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: (chuckling) We all on the same team, Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: JUNEBUG
dialogues.text: (scrambling to his feet) School this nigga!

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: (chuckling) Look like he schooling you, son.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 38. As the BMW pulls off, a humiliated Junebug turns to Marcu

dialogues.speaker: JUNEBUG
dialogues.text: I’ma see about you, motherfucker. In response, Marcus kick him in the ass. And as Junebug stumbles off, a Fiend approaches. Marcus makes a sale...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Within seventeen days, I flipped that key -- twice. Finally I had the cash I needed to be somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a SALESMAN waits on a CUSTOMER nearby, Marcus, looking like a high school senior with a knapsack, circles a ‘94 Rover. He spots SALESMAN #2 walk by with some brochures.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Excuse me. The guy ignores him, continues on his way. Marcus frowns, looks at the clock - 2:20 p.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2:43 p.m. Marcus stands at the Land Rover rapping to hims as the first Salesman finishes with the Customer, who exi

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Excuse me, can I get some help?

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: I have some calls to return.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I wanna buy this car here.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Me too, kid. The Salesman heads off. Marcus stands there a beat, then looks around, spots the SALES OFFICES, heads toward them.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 39. INT. CAR DEALERSHIP - MANAGER’S OFFICE ~- DAY JACKIE, 40s, a polyester-clad sales manager with a bad co over, sits at his desk talking into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: So I'll talk to my guy at BMW... Marcus appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You the manager?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: (hand over mouthpiece) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I’m tryin’ to buy a Land Rover.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: Talk to one of the salespeople. (into phone) You sure you wanna go with silver?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I did already, they treatin’ me like I’m invisible.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: We're very busy here, son. {into phone) I'm sorry, you said silver, right? As Jackie continues his call, Marcus approaches the desk, unzips his knapsack. He turns it upside down -- dozens of rubber-banded stacks of CASH spill out. Jackie looks at t money, stunned. He hangs up the phone, looks at Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE
dialogues.text: What‘d you say, a Land Rover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jackie looks on, Marcus drives the Land Rover off the dealership lot, lurching and screeching as he heads off.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: One thing about cash is it will get a motherfucker’s attention. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 40. MARCUS (V.O.) (cont'd) I didn‘t even know how to drive and I left there with a car. Cat even lent me dealer plates till I could manage to get a license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus beams as he sits in the driver's seat of the Land Rover; Antwan, Keryl, Tyrell and Romeo check it out.

dialogues.speaker: ANTWAN
dialogues.text: Will you look at this shit?!

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: That is a hype fuckin’ ride!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Power moon roof, fuckin’ leather.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: The coochie you gonna get with this, nigga!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Check it out, all Alpine-d up. Marcus hits the stereo; rap blares.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: Good for you, b, you fuckin’ deserve it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His Crew riding with him, Marcus cruises Rockaway Bouleva rapping along with the stereo. On the street, GIRLS look over; some wave, shake their asses. Our guys go crazy.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Fuck Bank of America, a nigga from the hood‘'ll wear his money on his back. Clothes, jewelry, cars. Marcus passes Junebug on the corner, who shoots him a loo pure, bitter envy.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Way we look at it, what good’s ownin’ shit if people can’t fuckin’ see it?  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowded club, PATRONS spilling out onto the street. Marcus and the Crew, now dressed to go out, pull up in the Land Rover, park it around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That night we took Antwan out for his birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music pumping. HOTTIES pack the dance floor, GANGSTAS, HUSTLERS and NEIGHBORHOOD GUYS everywhere. As the CAMERA PANS the CROWD, we find Marcus in

dialogues.speaker: THE VIP SECTION,
dialogues.text: a hottie named KEISHA hanging all over him as he pours Cristal. At the table with him, also with GIRLS, are Rome Tyrell, Keryl and guest of honor Antwan.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS,
dialogues.text: Seventeen, nigga. Old enough for the Army now.

dialogues.speaker: ANTWAN
dialogues.text: Fuck that, I’m already at war.

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: You at war with my nose, that stink- ass fuckin’ cologne you wearin’.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: {as they laugh) Can you see this nigga in the Army?

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: {mocking Antwan) Excuse me sergeant, these boots come in purple? More laughter. Marcus raises his glass:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Happy birthday, dawg. They all toast. Just then, a commotion at the front door. Marcus and the guys look over to see DARIUS CLAY, 30s, wearing heavy gold chains and a leather pork-pie hat. As he enters with a small entourage, the CROWD swarms him.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 42.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Fuck, check it -- Darius Clay.

dialogues.speaker: KEISHA
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: ANTWAN
dialogues.text: You fuckin’ serious?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Nigga’s one of the biggest record producers in the world. The music continues as Darius disappears into the crowd. After a while, the DJ takes the mic.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Y‘all ready for some free-style? {the Crowd cheers) Aight, let’s give it up for Dangerous. Marcus watches a GANGSTA RAPPER (Dangerous) take the stag start free-styling. His face changes as the CAMERA PUSHES on him -- does he wish it was him up there? He looks over Darius Clay, who’s taking in Dangerous from a table acros the way. After a beat, Marcus starts to head off.

dialogues.speaker: KEISHA
dialogues.text: Where you goin’ baby? Marcus crosses off to the men‘s room... INT. MEN‘S ROOM - NIGHT Marcus finishes taking a leak, then crosses to the sink, where another GUY is washing his hands. They finish, reac for a towel at the same time, look up at each other...

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Marcus?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: {as they hug) . Cameron! Shit, what up, doe, whatchu doin’ home?

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Spring break, you know. Here with some people from school.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 43.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Come sit by us, VIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Darius watches another RAPPER free-style lame gangsta shit, we PAN TO THE VIP SECTION. Cameron has now joined t group, but Keisha is over at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: This here was my fuckin’ nigga, yo. Math class, algebra and shit? I copied everything off his ass.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: You would've done some work, you might've passed on your own.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I know how to count nigga, that‘s all the math I need.

dialogues.speaker: ANTWAN
dialogues.text: (toasts with champagne) I heard that. Just then Tyrell approaches, leans in to talk to Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: Lemme get your keys, yo.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Where you goin’?

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: Nowhere, back seat, man, this bitch over there itchin’ to go. Marcus looks - a really HOT GIRL busting out of spandex w at the edge of the VIP section. Marcus hands over the key

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Make sure that jimmy nice and tight, you bust a nut on that leather you gettin’ the whole fuckin‘ thing detailed. Tyrell chuckles, takes the keys, exits with the Girl.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: A-ight, give it up for Chilly T!  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 44, Moderate applause for the lame GANGSTA RAPPER.

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: Chilly T. This nigga sucks.

dialogues.speaker: ANTWAN
dialogues.text: Whyn‘t you rock the mic, then? Call yourself Chili Fries.

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: Fuck you, nigga. They all laugh. Cameron turns to Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: You still rappin‘?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I dunno, not really. Fuckin’ around.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Fuck that, you can’t shut this nigga up half the time.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Like when we were kids.

dialogues.speaker: LEILANI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Cameron, we're leavin’! Cameron looks over -- on the dance floor, LEILANI, 19, st with a few other college students including CHARLENE, a v pretty neighborhood girl the same age; Marcus checks her

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Hold up, I gotta get my coat.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: It ain’t like that, she’s just a friend from school.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (re: Charlene) No, no, the one in the blue dress.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: I don’t know, her friend. Great seeing you, man.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 45.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You too bro, don’t be a stranger, call a nigga. Cameron nods, crosses off with Leilani to get his coat. Marcus approaches Charlene, pulls her arm.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Where you goin‘, it’s early.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: It’s two o’clock in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Not everywhere. Shit, in Hawaii it’s probably only lunch time.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: (thinks a second; then) Actually it’s dinner time in Hawaii, but unfortunately we’re not there.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I could make that happen real quick if that’s where you wanna go.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: I’m going home to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: So I’1l come by, help you relax.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Thanks, but I don’t play that.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Where you from, ‘round the way?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Baisley Houses.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Project girl.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Not for long, I got plans in life.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: That’s cool. So lemme get your number, I'll hit you up.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 46.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Look, you're very cute, okay, but I have a boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You got a boyfriend, where is he? You was my girl I‘d be right there at your side.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: He's away at college.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: College? Girl I could teach you more in one night than he'll learn in fifty years of college. From across the dance floor, Leilani calls out.

dialogues.speaker: LEILANI
dialogues.text: Charlene, come on!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: I really have to go. Can I have my arm back, please?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Hold up, c’mon, how I get to see you again?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Close your eyes and dream? Charlene crosses off. Marcus stares after her as if he’s a trance. Keisha approaches, notices him looking.

dialogues.speaker: KEISHA
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is that bitch?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Get off my dick. Marcus turns his back on her, heads back to the VIP secti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the sounds of moaning, the Land Rover is rocking, windows fogged as Tyrell fucks the Hot Girl from the club  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of breath and sweaty, Tyrell pulls his pants on as th Girl finishes straightening herself out.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: Damn girl, I knew you was a little fuck machine soon I saw you.

dialogues.speaker: HOT GIRL
dialogues.text: You fucked me so nasty, baby.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: Well gimme your number, I’1ll come by do it again. You ready? The Girl nods. Tyrell opens the door, steps out and...

dialogues.speaker: GANGSTA
dialogues.text: Out the fuckin’ car nigga! GANGSTA #1 grabs Tyrell, jams a .9mm against his head. As shoves him to the street, the Hot Girl screams, runs off.

dialogues.speaker: GANGSTA
dialogues.text: Where’s the fuckin’ keys?!

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: I... my... my pocket.

dialogues.speaker: GANGSTA
dialogues.text: Give it up, motherfucker! As Tyrell fumbles for the keys, Gangsta #2 looks around.

dialogues.speaker: GANGSTA
dialogues.text: Fuck it, just do this nigga, c’mon! And just as Gangsta #1 raises his gun to Tyrell‘s head... BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! Shots ring out from behind. It's MARCUS, approaching, blasting away with his .380, hi Crew behind him reaching for their guns. Gangsta #2 takes off as Gangsta #1 fires back, hitting ANTWAN in the head. He goes down, bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: Fuck!!  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 48. Marcus keeps firing, then Gangsta #1 takes off running to disappearing up the street. As Keryl helps Antwan, Romeo Marcus runs up to Tyrell, still on his knees.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: It's okay, yo, you‘re all right.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: (to Marcus) Yo man, I know them fuckin’ niggas! Marcus turns to Keryl, hovering over Antwan.

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: Call a fuckin’ ambulance!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Fuck that, get him in the car. As a crowd of Patrons gather from the club, Keryl and Rom load Antwan into the Land Rover, blood pouring from his wound. And as the rest of the Crew piles in, Marcus takes off, police SIRENS in the distance...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: We took Antwan to a hospital in the Bronx, told ‘em he got shot by a group of niggas tried to rob him... he died the next day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few dozen MOURNERS stand near a coffin as a PRIEST read from a bible. Marcus & the Crew fight back tears.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Much as we tried to hide it, losin’ our boy hurt like hell. And in the hood, when someone hurts you... you fuckin’ hurt them back. INT. MARCUS’ APARTMENT - (LIVING ROOM) NIGHT Still in their funeral clothes, Marcus, Romeo, Tyrell and Keryl sit around drinking.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: I’m tellin’ you thems was Rockaway niggas, I seen ‘em over there.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 49.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: There it is then, we roll on up.

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: Who gonna do it?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: Fuck that, them niggas is mine. Pull me out the car like that? Shit. Just get me a clean gat.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: When you roll with a crew, you gotta be willin’ to die for each other. You gotta be willin’ to kill for each other too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late. Quiet. A group of four GANGSTAS, including the two from the attempted jacking, stand bullshitting on a corne A stolen Honda Accord cruises by unnoticed, Tyrell at the wheel, Marcus next to him, Keryl and Romeo in back.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: That’s them, right there.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: I told you motherfuckers.

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: Pull over, pull over.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: A few nights later, we found them niggas at the projects in Rockaway. Unseen by the Gangstas, Romeo pulls over in front of a pa MOVING VAN about 30 yards up the street. Marcus produces Glock .9mm, hands it to Tyrell, who looks around nervousl

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: You sure this is cool?  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 50.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: It’s cool, yo. You take this gat, you walk up real slow, keep it at your side. You get up close... Marcus notices Tyrell is trembling. A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Fuck it, you know what? Lemme show you how to pop these niggas. And before anyone can say a word, Marcus is out of the ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet and calm, Marcus walks toward the Gangstas as the C looks on from the Honda. As he gets within ten feet:

dialogues.speaker: GANGSTA
dialogues.text: Hey yo, what up? Who you here-~

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: Marcus empties the clip into the Crowd; the Gangstas go d writhing, screaming. As he calmly walks back to the Honda

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: If I didn't have the respect of my crew already, I sure as shit did by the time I got back in that car. From that moment on, they knew I‘d never ask them to do anything I wouldn’t do myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus gets in. Tyrell and the others look at him, stunne

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You wanna drive, motherfucker? Romeo snaps out of it, puts the car in gear and pulls off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus and the Crew stand outside working the street.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Nobody fucked with us after that...  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 51. INT. TOPCAT‘S APARTMENT - KITCHEN - DAY Marcus sits at the table laying out dozens of bundles of CASH. Topcat enters with three kilos of coke.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We was ridin’ high... INT. MARCUS’ APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM ~- DAY With a few Hotties hanging with them, Marcus, Keryl, Tyre and Romeo put crack into vials, watching “Scarface” on DV

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Makin’ mad fuckin’ money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the crew nearby, Marcus leans in the window of a Dod Caravan, sells a few vials to a huge black quy with a goa

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We were pumpin’ hard all day... INT. MARCUS’ APARTMENT - BEDROOM - NIGHT With the sounds of a party out the window, Marcus fucks t shit out of a neighborhood HOTTIE.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And pumpin’ even harder at night... EXT. MARCUS‘ APARTMENT BUILDING - POOL AREA - NIGHT A wild party is in progress; music, forties, food. GIRLS everywhere, many topless, splashing in the pool.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Before long, the whole crew was livin’ in my building. It was like havin’ our own fuckin’ castle -- and I was the king. As the CAMERA PANS the group, we find Marcus in a lounge chair, the HOTTIE he was just fucking massaging his shoulders. Romeo approaches with a shopping bag.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 52.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Yo, check this out. He removes an Uzi from the bag.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Fuck, where you get this?

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Nigga K-Dog, two hundred dollars. Just then, Marcus’ beeper goes off. He checks it, gets up INT. MARCUS’ APARTMENT - KITCHEN - NIGHT Marcus stands at the counter mixing a drink as he finishe dialing his cell. In the living room, Keryl and Tyrell ch out the Uzi while Romeo starts grinding with a GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (into phone) S’‘up, it’s me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Topcat sits in a red BMW, talks on his cell.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Drop what you doin’, meet me down Merrick, we takin’ a ride.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: When, now?

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Fuck I just say? Topcat clicks off. Marcus hangs up, looks at Romeo, now making out with the Girl on his couch. As he exits:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Take that bitch down your own crib. Fuckin’ stink up my couch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deserted, industrial area. Topcat and Marcus pull up in the BMW. Several other luxury cars are already there.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 53.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Fuck's this shit?

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Damn if I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Topcat and Marcus enter the huge garage, where Majestic, Breeze and about two dozen other HUSTLERS are waiting. Breeze pulls down the gates, locking them all inside. The Hustlers exchange wary looks. Majestic scans the group.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: So I know y’all are askin’ yourself what the fuck’s goin’ on here -~ I‘d be askin’ myself that very same question. Majestic paces among the group. It’s very tense.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: See the thing’s this -- when you work for McDonald’s, you can‘t buy your burgers from White Castle, right? Now why is that? Majestic stops at a nervous-looking Junebug.

dialogues.speaker: JUNEBUG
dialogues.text: Ain’t part the same company.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: See even though you might get a better deal buyin’ from White Castle, in the long run it fucks everybody in the franchise, you feelin’ me? Majestic scans the group. They nod.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: See right there then, that’s why we here. One of you motherfuckers been buyin’ from White Castle. Majestic looks at them, lingers on Topcat. We piay the tension, then he motions for the group te follow him. In the next room, hanging from the chains of a ten-ton auto body straightener, is the horribly beaten and bloodied ODELL, duct tape over his mouth. Breeze crosses to him.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd’ Revision 09/12/04 54.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: This nigga Odell been in business for himself, buyin’ his shit from the Colombians instead of us. Breeze yanks the piece of duct-tape from Odell’s mouth. He starts blubbering, crying, gold teeth flashing.

dialogues.speaker: ODELL
dialogues.text: No man, that ain’t how it is, please listen to me! Please!

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: (backhands him) Shut your fuckin‘ mouth! Majestic approaches. Odell sobs like a baby.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: Far as I’m concerned, you owe these niggas here a whole lot of money. Now how you gonna pay it back?

dialogues.speaker: ODELL
dialogues.text: (crying; sobbing) I‘ll do whatever you say, tell me, man! Please, I’ll do it! Please! As Odell sobs, Majestic looks at Breeze. Together they do well-rehearsed routine for the benefit of the Group.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: What we gonna do, how this nigga gonna pay these gentlemen back?

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: How ‘bout he pay ‘em in gold?

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: You right, motherfucker, them shiny- ass teeth!

dialogues.speaker: ODELL
dialogues.text: Not! Nol! Please!! As the Group exchanges looks, Breeze crosses to a tool bo methodically chooses a pair of 11-inch diagonal pliers. H approaches Odell, who screams, wriggling on the chains...

dialogues.speaker: ODELL
dialogues.text: Nol! No!!  Untitled 50 cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 55. WHAMM!! Breeze punches Odell square in the face, jamming the pliers into his mouth. As he grips a tooth, we hear a sickening CRUNCH through Odell’s screams. Breeze yanks ha on the pliers, pulls a bloody gold incisor out of Odell’s head by the roots. Odell SCREAMS in agony.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Relax nigga, you only got but ten more ‘fore I put that bullet in your brain. Breeze jams the pliers in again. And as Odell SHRIEKS in agony, the CAMERA PANS the group, settling on Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: If you play with fire long enough, you will get burned. EXT. MARCUS’ APARTMENT BUILDING - DAWN Topcat drops Marcus off at the curb. He crosses to the fr door as the BMW pulls off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: And in the crack game, heat comes in many forms. INT. MARCUS’ APARTMENT BUILDING - LOBBY - CONTINUOUS Marcus opens the lobby door. And as soon as he steps insi

dialogues.speaker: DEA AGENT
dialogues.text: Freeze! Hands in the air!! Marcus is slammed against the wall, spread-eagled. The lo is swarming with DEA AGENTS, guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The first thing I thought was they knew about Odeli, but that shit just happened like an hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: DEA AGENT
dialogues.text: Hey asshole, remember me? Marcus turns around. DEA AGENT #2 looks familiar...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
