dialogues.text: Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 56. CLICK. Marcus on the street. CLICK. Marcus leans into a Dodge Caravan. CLICK. He exchanges crack for money. CLICK The Driver is DEA AGENT #2, the huge, goateed black guy.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Marcus is handcuffed.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Turned out this had nothin’ to do with Odell -- they had a warrant to search my crib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A handcuffed Marcus sits as the DEA AGENTS ransack the pl emptying contents of drawers on the floor. On the coffee table are 2 ounces of cocaine, cash and a dozen crack via

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Lucky for my ass I was light on product and didn’t have too much incriminatin’ shit lyin’ around.

dialogues.speaker: DEA AGENT
dialogues.text: Look what I found. Locked and loaded. AGENT #3 emerges from the bedroom with Romeo’s loaded Uzi

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Incriminatin’ shit of my own, that is. And as Marcus is led off, we see his toy plastic Soldier among the debris on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing a suit and tie, Marcus stands with his LAWYER bef a female JUDGE, who reads from a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Mr. Philips, you are hereby sentenced to a term of no less than three years in a Federal penitentiary. The Judge bangs her gavel. Marcus turns to face his weepi Grandma, who sits with his Grandpa and the Crew.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 57.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I guess there’s no such thing as a good time to be goin’ to jail, but this shit was fucked. INT. PRISON -— DAY Wearing an orange jumpsuit, carrying his prison-issue bla and toiletries, Marcus is led past the cells.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I had had it all and lost everything. The mostly black INMATES hoot at him from behind bars.

dialogues.speaker: INMATE
dialogues.text: Ooohhh, look at this little nigga!

dialogues.speaker: INMATE
dialogues.text: Whatchu do boy?!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Worst of all they sent me to Ohio, where I didn’t know a fuckin’ soul. Marcus enters a cell, sits on a cot across from a sleepin INMATE. The door closes behind him with a heavy CLANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bustling; lunch time. Marcus sits alone eating, a few ext salt packets on his tray.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The thing about prison’s that everything's a test. Niggas read you, then they try you. As Marcus eats, an inmate in a red SKULL-CAP approaches.

dialogues.speaker: SKULL CAP
dialogues.text: Yo man, I get some of that salt?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Someone asks you for somethin’, even if they friendly about it? Bulishit, they sizin‘’ you up. The guy reaches for a salt packet. Marcus knocks his hand away, stands up.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 58.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Fuck off, motherfucker. The hall goes quiet; INMATES look over to see how this wi play out. A brief stare-down, then Skull Cap crosses off.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: First it’s your salt, then it’s your food, next thing you doin’ some nigga’s laundry. Marcus sits down, goes back to his meal.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS,, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Whatever you do, you gotta send a message, nip that shit in the bud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INMATES lift weights, play basketball. Off in a corner, t camera finds a twitchy, crazy-looking inmate we'll come t know as BAMA, 21, doing dumbbell curls, HOWLING like a wo as he does. Nearby, Marcus does pull-ups, ignoring him. ACROSS THE YARD Skull Cap and three other Inmates watch Marcus from around a weight bench. One of them hands skul Cap a shiv, which he slips under a towel. Very casually, group crosses toward Marcus, whose back is turned as he d pull-ups. Bama, the howler, senses what’s happening. As Skull Cap nears Marcus:

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: Watch your back, nigga. Bama HOWLS as Marcus drops off the bar, sees SKULL CAP ch him with the shiv. Skull Cap SLASHES, catching Marcus in shoulder with the blade, but Marcus side~steps, SLAMS his fist into Skull Cap‘s face, taking him down. As Marcus be the shit out of Skull Cap, one of his Crew charges in, bu

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: {howling like a wolf) Ow-ow-ocococowwww!! i! WHAMMM!! Bama slams a dumbbell across the guy’s head, tak him out. And as the other Crew Members charge, Bama joins the fight, swinging the dumbbell wildly, holding them off with Marcus. And as GUARDS swarm in...  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 59.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Though my shoulder was cut pretty bad, in the end it was more than worth it. Word spread quick that I wasn't someone to fuck with. INT. PRISON - MEN’S ROOM - DAY Marcus mops the filthy floor. At the other end of the roo Bama mops also.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What I couldn’t figure out was this crazy motherfucker. Marcus works his way near Bama. They work in silence, the

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Why’d you help me, man?

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I like fightin’.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Got beef with them other niggas?

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: (howling) Nope-nope-nooooece0co! ! Bama laughs; Marcus stares at him. They keep working.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Where you from?

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: Down South, how about you?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Queens, New York. Name’s Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: I‘m Bama.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You from Alabama?

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: North Carolina.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Why they call you Bama, then?  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 60.

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: Cause “Lina” sound stupid. Marcus nods. They continue mopping. Bama twitches.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: By total accident my first week there, I had hooked up with the craziest nigga in the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Months later. As a group of other Inmates sit nearby pla cards, Marcus plays checkers with Bama, who makes a move.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But crazy or not, havin’ a friend made the months pass a lot quicker.

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: Ow-ooocoh! King my black ass! As Marcus kings Bama’s checker, a GUARD approaches:

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Philips, you have a visitor. INT. PRISON - VISITOR’S AREA - DAY A row of phones separated by Plexiglass. While other Inma talk with VISITORS, Marcus enters, spots Cameron. He sits picks up the phone, smiles. Cameron does the same.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: I brought you a cake with a file in it, but I got hungry on the way and ate it.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Thanks for comin’ down here man. I appreciate it.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Of course, are you kidding? So how you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Hangin’ in there. How about you?  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 61.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Good, you know. Graduate next month, got accepted to St. John’s.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got your letter. Law school now, huh?

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: I figured with friends like you, I’ll always have clients.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Not me b, this is the last time for this shit.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Mean I ain’t gettin’ caught again. Cameron nods. A few beats, then:

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: So what do you do with yourself all day?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Work in the mornin’, group therapy, shit like that.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: What about at night?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Nothin’, you know. Just chill.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: So how about instead of you serving time, why not let time serve you? Get your GED. Read. Write.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Fuck I’ma write?

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Anything, I don’t know. Write lyrics. Like when we were kids? {off Marcus’ chuckling) What, you were great.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 62.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: That was just fuckin‘ around.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: You have talent, Marcus. The guys get quiet. Finally, Marcus changes the subject:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Ever see that girl anymore, the one in the blue dress? Charlene?

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (shakes his head no) Leilani transferred. Marcus nods. An awkward moment. They sit in silence.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: I didn’t come here to break your balls, okay? I just think you could do more with your life than stand on a corner selling drugs. Marcus looks at him awhile, finally smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You know anybody else talked to me like that I’d pop ‘em in the teeth.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: You don’t want to hit a lawyer, brother. I'll sue your ass from now till forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus works a lathe, other Inmates working nearby.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Though I didn’t tell him, Cameron's visit gave me a lot to think about. Besides dealing drugs, music was the one business that could give me the lifestyle I wanted with none of the risk. Money. Power. Pussy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus sits with Bama and some other Inmates watching a gangsta music video on television.  Untitled 50 cent Project and Revision 09/12/04 63.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I mean watch TV, half these motherfuckers are paper gangstas, singin‘ about shit they only seen in movies -- I was livin’ it every day. I decided right there to formulate a plan. INT. PRISON - MARCUS’S CELL - NIGHT Marcus lays on his cot listening to a Discman, rapping to himself as he writes lyrics in a notebook. Bama sits near cleaning his sneakers.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I’d bust my ass, work on my music and within five years move me and my crew into the rap game. For the meantime, though, the crack game was still how I planned to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Greyhound Bus heads down the road, passing a sign that “New York”. Through a window we see Marcus, still wearing his Discman, rapping to himself.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Before I knew it, my time was up and I hit the ground runnin’. First thing I did was make a demo of some shit I wrote inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A makeshift recording “studio”, with blankets for a sound booth. Marcus raps into a microphone over a simple beat.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Second was scam a meetin’ with Darius Clay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, nondescript building in Queens. As Marcus stands across the street, Darius Clay pulls up in a Mercedes, pa it in the lot. As he heads toward the building...  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 64.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Mr. Clay, can I talk to you?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS CLAY
dialogues.text: Ain‘t that what you doin’ now? Darius doesn’t break stride. Marcus walks alongside him.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah, I... I’m a rapper, my name’s Marcus Philips.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS CLAY
dialogues.text: Son, you ain't no rapper, ‘cause if you was a rapper, I woulda heard of you. What you are is a wanna-be.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (holds up tape) Whatever, yeah... I got a demo.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS CLAY
dialogues.text: Pop it in the mail with a letter.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: But I‘m here now. You ain’t got two minutes?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS CLAY
dialogues.text: I ain’t got one. Darius leaves him standing there, starts into the buildin

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Would you have left Tupac in a parkin’ lot with a tape in his hands?

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS CLAY
dialogues.text: (smiles; keeps walking) You ain’t no Tupac.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: How do you know? Darius stops in his tracks. Turns around. A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS CLAY
dialogues.text: Two minutes.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus sits at a sound board with Darius Clay and his producer, TONY CASH. They listen to the demo a while (a v rough version of "I’m a Rider”) then Darius shuts it off.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS CLAY
dialogues.text: It‘s some real tight shit, but it’s raw, know I‘m sayin’?

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: You got natural talent, but what you need to learn are the rudiments of song writing.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS CLAY
dialogues.text: And for the record, you ain’t no damn Tupac.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (smiles) School me then, that’s why I’m here.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS CLAY
dialogues.text: Good. Now any song, any melody, is broken up into bars, right? And as Marcus listens intently...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That weekend there was a party for me at the community center. It was great bein’ home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON -- a banner reading “Welcome Home Marcus”. PULL BACK TO REVEAL the entire Crew, along with Topcat, Majest Breeze and several dozen other GUESTS, applauding as Marc enters. They converge on him with hugs.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Welcome back, dawg. We missed your black ass. As a RAPPER takes the mic and freestyles, Marcus crosses to the bar with Romeo, who hands him a bottle of Cristal. Tyrell approaches in a new suit, looking sharper than eve  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 66.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (as they hug} Look at this nigga, fuckin’ Denzel over here! How you doin’ man?

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: Gettin’ my money.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: That's some real shit there, wait you see this nigga‘’s ride.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: New Lexus. Cherry fuckin’ red. MARCUS. Now you biggin’ up on me, huh?

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: I’m in charge, man, I-- (catches himself) I mean with you away, you know what I fuckin’ mean. Marcus clocks Tyrell’s attitude, but before he can say anything, Keryl approaches -- about 40 pounds lighter tha last we've seen him.

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: There’s my nigga!!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Oh fuck, they stop feedin’ your ass?!

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: Dick Gregory, fuckin’ protein powder.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: Now we can’t call him fat no more.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Now he just a dumb motherfucker. They all laugh. Across the room, the Rapper finishes up. The DJ takes the mic...

dialogues.speaker: DS
dialogues.text: Marcus, come on up here. {off his reluctance) C’mon, say a few words!  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 67. The CROWD cheers. Marcus heads to the DJ, grabs the mic.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yo, how y’all doin’? (the Crowd cheers) First off, I wanna say thanks to ya‘ll, I fuckin’ missed your asses.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: Missed you too, dawg.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Well I’m back now and we ain't goin’ no place but up. Where my niggas at? {the Crew goes wild) I said any gangsta niggas in the house?! (even wilder) This is for you. A beat starts. The CROWD starts bouncing, then Marcus kic in with “I’m a Rider”. THE CROWD goes wild; Marcus owns t place. He finishes up to thunderous applause, crosses to. INT. MEN’S ROOM - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS Marcus enters, heads to a stall, opens the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...jJust as Topcat finishes snorting a spoonful of heroin

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Sorry, I-- (notices the heroin) Fuck you doin’?

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Little h, that’s all. Want some?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Since when you do that shit?

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ wired man, unwindin’ a bit. Topcat steps out of the stall. An awkward moment.  untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 68.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: You look good, b, come see me. I'll get you back in business. Marcus nods; they hug stiffly. Topcat wipes his nose, exi

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Great as it was to be home, what you gotta remember about bein’ away is this -- much as you think it won‘t -- the world outside keeps turnin’ without you. INT. TOPCAT’S APARTMENT - DAY : Marcus cops a half a kilo from Topcat.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: With my cash reserves near empty, I saw Topcat the next day. I got some product on consignment and went right to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of CUTS: With Junebug working the street nearby, Marcus & the Crew sell to various Fiends.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was fuckin’ possessed, I hardly even slept. But hard as I worked at the crack game, I worked twice as hard at my music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Darius Clay and Tony Cash work the sound board, Marcus wears headphones, rapping into a microphone over a beat.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: My life became a blur of pumpin’ erack, writin’ lyrics and recordin’ demos. Half the time I didn’t even know what fuckin’ day it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus hustles on the street; Marcus in his apartment wri lyrics in a notebook, Marcus recording in the studio.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 69.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: In a few months Bama was out and he joined the crew. Say what you will bout a country-ass nigga, but these motherfuckers have a work ethic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Keryl acts as lookout, Bama sells crack from a small h in the door to a line of FIENDS who wait outside.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: In addition to runnin’ a house he found, Bama took it on himself to branch out into insurance scams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bama stands at the counter filling out paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He‘d rent a U-Haul, max it out on liability insurance, then rent a limo and pack it with fiends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black stretch LIMO rolls down the street.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: At the appointed time... SCREECH...CRASH!! A 14-foot U~Haul driven by Bama appears out of nowhere, rear-ends the LIMO at a very moderate spe

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Every one of them niggas would have severe back and neck injuries. The FIENDS, all dressed in party clothes, stagger from th limo exaggeratedly holding their back and necks.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We'd give ‘em each a grand for their trouble, send ‘em to fugazy doctors we lined up, then collect when the insurance money rolled in.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bama sits on the bed talking on the phone as an ELDERLY L 80s, sits in a chair nearby, purse on her lap.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I finally got called in when Bama started kidnappin’ niggas. I mean this motherfucker was snatchin’ people we knew!

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: .Yo, Edgar, I got your Grandma, you wanna see her again lemme hold twenty thousand. {hands phone to old lady) He wanna talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a BODYGUARD stands nearby, Marcus and Bama sit across table from Majestic and Breeze.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: So what's this shit, your boy here ain’t makin’ enough money?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: It ain’t like that, it’s--

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: Shit gotta stop, this ain’t the wild west, motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: Fuck that man, all I'm tryin‘--

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Nobody talkin‘ to you, nigga.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (to Breeze) Take it easy, a-ight? {to Bama) Go wait outside.

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: You sure?  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 71.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Go. Bama gets up, HOWLING as he exits. As soon as he’s gone:

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: Fuck’s wrong with this nigga?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: He's a little fucked-up, a-ight?

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: Little fucked-up? Pay attention. Nigga like that get you killed.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: He's ambitious, that’s all, he likes makin’ money.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: And what about you?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What about me?

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: I hear you over that studio every day, that tells me you ain’t tendin’ to business.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I'm earnin’ more than ever.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: Well see it fuckin’ stays that way. And keep that country-ass nigga on a leash. On Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus pulls up in a brand new Mercedes, parks.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Later that day I dropped Bama at the doctor for his own fake claim from the U-haul shit. Bama wears a phony neck-brace; Marcus helps him from the  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 72.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I’m serious yo, you don't start chillin’ you'll be wearin’ one of them shits for real.

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: I’m the wolfman dawg, fuck you worried about?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (play shoves him) I’m serious, motherfucker. Bama laughs as they head to the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus reads a magazine, Bama next to him twitching. From behind the desk, the RECEPTIONIST reads the sign-in sheet

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Elijah Samuels? (off Bama‘s look) The doctor will see you. As Bama disappears inside, the Receptionist calls out:

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Charlene, I'm goin’ to lunch.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Bring me back a Diet Coke? As the Receptionist exits, she is replaced at the desk by Charlene, the girl we met earlier at Club Starlight. As s busies herself with paperwork, Marcus smiles and approach

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: (not even looking up) Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m here ‘cause of a broken heart. (she looks up) I met this girl at a club a few years back but she wouldn’t give me her number.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 73. Charlene’s jaw drops.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: How you been?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Good, good, you know...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Still in college?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: I took some time off, I’m thinking of going to nursing school.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Well like I said, I got this broken heart here.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: That sounds a little advanced for me.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You seem like a smart girl, I bet you could handle it. still got a boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: / CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Not at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (touches his heart) So can I call you, make an appointment for this thing? Charlene debates it, then smiles, writes her number down.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Office hours are Saturday nights only. And I don’t take Medicare. Bama emerges as Marcus smiles, takes the slip of paper.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I'm feelin’ better already. Marcus exits with Bama. On Charlene.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked near a McDonald’s, Marcus and Bama eat, just hangi out. Across the street, a gleaming black BMW sedan pulls

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Check this shit. A LARGE COLOMBIAN MAN in a suit emerges from the Beemer, heads into the Check Cashing Store with a briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Colombians. Use that place to launder money.

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: Real Tony Montana shit. As they eat, Marcus looks down the block, spots

dialogues.speaker: JUNEBUG
dialogues.text: emerging from a bodega, heading their way. Quietly, Marcu slips his .9mm from his waistband.

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: “sup?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Bitch-ass nigga Junebug. We play the tension as Junebug passes. Marcus stares at h then goes back to eating in silence with Bama. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: Till I came here you know I never really had no friends.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: That’s cause you a crazy-ass nigga.

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: I'm serious, yo. Thanks for stickin’ up for my ass. Marcus nods, says nothing. They continue eating...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: When you run a crew, you can rarely afford to show your men kindness, not even for a second. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 MARCUS (V.0.) (cont'd) Especially in the crack game, where a second can mean the difference between ridin’ in a limo or ridin’ in a hearse. EXT. CHARLENE’S APARTMENT BUILDING - NIGHT 75. A black stretch limo is parked at the curb; its DRIVER st waiting. Marcus emerges from the building with Charlene, wears a beautiful dress. As the limo pulls off, we see th it’s being followed by a White Bronco with tinted glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the Manhattan skyline glistening in the background, Marcus and Charlene sit at a romantic table for two. They toast with champagne, then begin eating.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: So let‘s see. Champagne, limo, fancy restaurant. I guess you must be an investment banker or something.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Somethin’ like that.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: That why you got your boys over there watching your back? At a nearby table, we see Bama sitting with Keryl.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (smiles) Does it matter?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Depends how far this goes. {a few beats; then) Tell you the truth, I suppose I already know what you do.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: But you went out with me anyway.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Guess I have a thing for bad boys. But not too bad. Marcus smiles.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 76.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: So why would a guy like you be interested in someone like me?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Someone like you? You’re beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Working girl, straight-laced.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I like someone challenging, I dunno. Someone I can talk to.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Challenging, huh?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: To a. point. Charlene smiles. They continue eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus and Charlene walk along the water.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: So how’d you get into... investment banking, is it?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Family business, I had no choice.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Your daddy was a player?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: My moms.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Your mother?!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Maybe that’s why I like strong women. Charlene smiles. They continue walking. Ten paces behind, we see Bama and Keryl following.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: They gonna be with us all night?  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 99/12/04 77.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (smiles) Not all night. INT. MARCUS’ APARTMENT ~ LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Marcus and Charlene sit on the couch; soft music; nightca

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: So when you said before you had no choice but to get into the game, what’d you mean by that?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: It’s where I’m from, you know. You play the cards you’re dealt.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: But sometimes you can trade the ones you were dealt for new ones.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: That‘s what I’m plannin’ on doin’.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Music. I been developin’ my skills, workin’ with Darius Clay.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Seriously?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS,
dialogues.text: Sent my demo out this week, tryin’ to get a record deal.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Really? That’s great.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (a few beats; then) So why didn’t you give me your number that night?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: I told you I had a boyfriend and...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: And what?  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 78.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Nothing. It’s corny.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Come on, what? Charlene looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: ‘Cause I knew if we were meant to, one day we'd meet again. Marcus looks at her, then:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I don’t think that’s corny at all. And as they kiss... INT. MARCUS‘ APARTMENT - BEDROOM - NIGHT The lights are dim. Marcus carries Charlene into the bedroom, gently places her on the bed. Slowly, they conti to kiss as they undress each other and begin to make love INT. MARCUS’ APARTMENT - BEDROOM ~ LATER Marcus sleeps alone in his bed. After a few beats, he sti looks at the clock -- 2:18 a.m. He notices a light on in living room, gets up to investigate. INT. MARCUS’ APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Marcus emerges in boxers. On the couch, wearing his shirt Charlene, who wears headphones, eyes closed as she listen music. Marcus comes up behind her, touches her. She jumps

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Jesus, you scared me!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (chuckling) Whatchu doin’, where’d you go?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: I wasn’t tired, so I came out here.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Whatchu listenin’ to?  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 79. Charlene smiles, holds up a CD -- “Marcus Philips - Demo”

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Nah, gimme that.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: No, I love it, it’s great.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You like it? Really?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? You’re really talented, you have a gift. Just then, the phone RINGS. Marcus checks the number.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I gotta take this.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Some other girl?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (shoots her a look; then) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Topcat, high off his ass and covered with blood, stands holding the phone. He slurs as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: It’s me, fuck you doin’?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I’m chillin’. Wassup?

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: I need you over here.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What‘s wrong, you all right?

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Just fuckin’ get here! Topcat clicks off. Marcus turns to Charlene.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 80.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I gotta take you home. INT. TOPCAT’S APARTMENT ~ LIVING ROOM - LATER Still high, Topcat opens the door, lets Marcus in. The pl is a shambles. Marcus notices the blood, spots a hypoderm needie, spoon and small bag of heroin on the coffee table

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: The fuck you doin’ to yourself?!

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: (plops on the couch) I dunno, man. This motherfucker...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What motherfucker, who?

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: It shoulda been me, son... it shoulda been me...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What you mean? Majestic?

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: You don’t know what the fuck you talkin’ about, boy! Levar...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Levar what? (puts it together) So you got passed over, this is how you deal with the shit? You become a fuckin’ junkie?! Topcat shakes his head, vaguely nods to the kitchen. Marc slowly makes his way inside, where we see SLIM, the hustl who killed his mother, lying dead on the floor with a kit knife plunged in his chest.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is this?!

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Nigga Slim, kill your mama. Saw him on the street, he came back around, I brought him up here. Marcus lunges, grabs Topcat by the shirt, lifts him up.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 Bl.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you call me?!

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: I don‘t... I... I didn‘t--

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I told you if you ever find this motherfucker let me know!

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: I didn't have--

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (shaking him) You junkie motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: (struggling to fight back) Don’t you talk to me like that, boy!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I ain’t your fuckin’ boy! Marcus shoves him back on the couch hard. Topcat looks up at him, eyes tearing up. After a few beats...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What? You got somethin’ you wanna say to me?

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: I loved her too, motherfucker... I fuckin’ loved that girl. Marcus looks at him, processing. An eternity, then...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: C‘mon, let‘s get rid of this shit. And as he pulls some Hefty bags out of a kitchen drawer.. INT. MARCUS’ APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - DAWN Marcus enters, pours himself a drink, then sits on the co

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We dumped the body in the weeds near the airport, then I dropped Topcat back at his crib.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 82. INT. TOPCAT’S APARTMENT - BATHROOM - DAY Topcat sits on the toilet, straps up, injects a huge shot heroin. After a few seconds, he begins convulsing.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It was the last time I‘d ever see him alive. Topcat stops moving.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I never did ask him straight up if he was my father or not, but for all we’d been through I guess he may as well have been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closed to the general public. As few BODYGUARDS look on, Marcus enters with Tyrell, joining Junebug and about a do other HUSTLERS at a long table. At the head sits Majestic Breeze next to him. Hennessy all around.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: So I'll get right to it. I spoke to the big man, he sends his condolences. Topcat was a real nigga. Majestic raises his glass. They all follow.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Rest in peace.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: Obviously y‘all are here cause some decisions have been made and this comes right from Levar himself. Majestic scans the contenders, all looking on in anticipation. Finally, he turns to Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: You takin’ over for T-Cat, Tyrell here your number two.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: (smiles) I didn‘t know Levar even knew my name.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 83.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Levar know everything, nigga.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: Any problems, let’s air it out now. Majestic trades looks with the other Hustlers, settling o Junebug, who does his best to hide his disdain.

dialogues.speaker: JUNEBUG
dialogues.text: Cool with me.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: It done, then.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: (to Marcus) God bless, man, you deserve it.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: Let's make some fuckin’ money. And as they raise their glasses, we hear the POP of a champagne cork and we're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus stands filling the Crew’s glasses from a bottle of Cristal as Charlene and a few other GIRLS look on.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What started out as a great day got even better by the afternoon... INT. MARCUS’ APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - DAY Marcus’ phone rings. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darius Clay talks on the phone. Tony Cash stands nearby.

dialogues.speaker: DARIUS CLAY
dialogues.text: Genesis Records wants to make a deal. They love your fuckin’ demo!  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music pumping; the dance floor is packed. Marcus and the Crew dance with their Girls.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I had no idea by night time I'd wish it never happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With rap music emanating from within, Bama appears, peeks the window. A few PATRONS drink at the bar, while at a ta in the back, Junebug and a few other HUSTLERS have drinks Suddenly, the door whips open. Bama enters, gun in hand, kerchief over his face.

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: On the floor motherfuckers! The Patrons do as they're told. Junebug studies Bama as h turns to the Bartender:

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: Empty that fuckin’ cash drawer! As he starts complying, the ladies room door opens. A you WOMAN exits... instinctively Bama turns and fires... BLAM!! BLAM!! Total chaos as the Woman goes down, blood splattering the wall behind her. And as Bama hauls ass...

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You specifically said you would curb this motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still wearing the same clothes from the night before, Marcus sits before Majestic and Breeze.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I know, I just... Look, it ain’t like he did it on purpose, a-ight?

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: He shot a nigga’s girl!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I didn’t know where he was.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 85.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: You didn’t know? You gotta know where your niggas at and what they doin’ at all times. Everything.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: Got these Brooklyn niggas up our ass now.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: We were out, okay? He was supposed to be with us, he didn't show up.

dialogues.speaker: BREEZE
dialogues.text: So what you’re sayin’ then‘s you can’t control this nigga.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: No, it’s just... It was an accident...

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: We been through this before. (as if to a child) The nigga can‘t follow orders, the nigga got to go. (off Marcus’ look) What? You got a problem with that? Marcus sits for a long time, says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: You got twenty four hours. Marcus nods, exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON -- a simple headstone: Katrina Philips 1961-1984 PULL BACK to reveal Marcus seated before it, deep in thou

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I don‘t know why, but until that day I never visited my mom’s grave. I sat there for hours, with everything I ever wanted and nothin’ all at the same time.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus walks alone through the headstones.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: As I walked to my car, I still didn’t know what I was gonna do. INT. MARCUS’ MERCEDES - DAY Parked outside the cemetery, Marcus sits in his car, dial his cell. We hear a number RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Majestic’s cell phone RINGS. He checks the number, answer

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: It's me.

dialogues.speaker: MAJESTIC
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Go fuck yourself. I ain‘t givin’ up my boy. Marcus clicks off.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Just like that, we were renegades. INT. ‘MARCUS’ APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT The whole Crew is there, in mid war council.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Are you out your fuckin’ mind?! How we gonna eat, man?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Same as always, keep on hustlin’.  Ontitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 87.

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: Majestic and that other motherfucker run this game.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: They run it, they don’t own it.

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: We can get our product down south.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Meantime, I’m gettin’ an advance on the record deal.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Enough for everybody?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: It ain’t a lot, but it should tide us over. No one says a word, Marcus looks at Tyrell.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You‘re bein’ awful quiet.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: It's fucked up, man. These niggas don’t play around.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (re: Bama) Whatchu want me to do, give his ass up?! If it was any of ya‘ll I'da done the same fuckin‘ thing! (a few beats; then) The door’s wide open. Anybody wants to go, now’s your chance, no repercussions. (off their looks) We're this fuckin’ close to gettin’ outta this shit, I‘m recordin’ this album and I’m gonna blow up. We all will if we just stick together. The guys exchange looks. A long time, then:

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: A-ight, I’m in.

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: Too far to back out now. Let‘s do this shit.  Untitled 50 cent Project "2nd Revision 09/12/04 88. Tyrell looks at Bama, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: Crazy ass nigga, whatchu go and do now? And on Marcus’ smile... INT. DC PRODUCTIONS -—- STUDIO - DAY Marcus stands in a sound booth singing into a mic.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS., (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Over the next few months, I worked my ass off in the studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus signs some papers as Darius Clay looks on.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The advance came in, but between lawyers, managers and Darius Clay, there wasn’t much left over. Darius hands Marcus a check. He looks at it, frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cold night. Marcus and the Crew stand around outside.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: On the street things weren’t much better. Not only did we have to watch our backs... A FORD TAURUS drives by slowly. Marcus and the Crew stick their hand under their coats. The FORD drives off.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It was also harder than ever to come by product. INT. MARCUS’ APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - DAY Wearing an expectant look, Marcus lets Romeo and Bama ins  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 89.

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: (takes out a package) Quarter key, that all he had.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: If there’s one thing I learned in life, it’s this -- as complicated as things seem, they could always get more complicated. INT. MARCUS’ APARTMENT - BEDROOM Marcus sits on the couch writing in his notebook, working his raps. After a beat, Charlene comes out of the bathroo She sits next to him, says nothing. After a while:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Why you so quiet, shorty? Charlene looks at him, holds up a home pregnancy test str its center is bright BLUE. Marcus processes it, then:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: How far are you?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: About twelve weeks.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Twelve weeks? What about your period?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: I was spotting, I’m sorry... (starts crying) I didn’t plan this.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: That's not what I‘m sayin’.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do, we have no money...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: My record’s comin’ out, it’s gonna blow up.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: You don’t know that, Marcus.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 90.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I thought you believed in me.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Ido. It’s just-- Charlene breaks down crying. Marcus holds her.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: A-ight, forget that shit for now. In a perfect world, what would you do?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Marcus, we have nothing! This is far from a perfect world.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I'll make it one, answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: (looks at him; then) In a perfect world? I’d have your baby.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Then that’s what we’re gonna do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same shot as the opening. The stolen Suburban sits near t Check Cashing Store, Keryl alone in the driver's seat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Koreans count out CASH, the Guard approaches the peephole, his .45 pistol still in its holster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rodrigo stands outside, holds up a Nathan's bag.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (as he unlocks the door) Fuck you been, I‘m starvin’ in-- BAMMMM!!! The door kicks in violently...  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keryl sits in the Suburban, looking toward the store. Suddenly, the gunshots -- the shotgun BLAST followed by the RAT-TAT-TAT-TAT-TAT-TAT of the Uzi. Within seconds, our GUYS come charging out. Romeo sprints to the Suburban, tosses the duffel bag inside. Marcus approaches with Bama, Tyrell following.

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: Fuck happened in there?!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Help me get him in! Romeo and Tyrell help Marcus lift Bama into the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A desolate road near JFK. Tyrell’s Lexus, Marcus’ Mercede and a Bronco parked nearby. As Keryl screeches up in the Suburban, the Crew jumps out, adrenaline still pumping.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: We fuckin’ did it!! Like a well-oiled machine, the guys scatter to their cars as Romeo empties a gas can over the Suburban's upholstery Marcus tosses the duffel in his trunk, starts to get in.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: My crib, tomorrow, 11 o’clock. With that, Romeo tosses a match in the Suburban. It goes in flames with a WHOOSH as the Crew take off in their car EXT. MARCUS’ APARTMENT BUILDING - (LATER THAT) NIGHT The street is quiet, deserted. Marcus pulls up in the Mercedes, finds a spot near the building.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Whoever said money can’t buy happiness shoulda been me on that ride home. He gets out, crosses to the trunk, POPS it.  Untitled 59 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 92.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: My music was on track, I was gonna be a father... For the first time in a long time it felt like everything was gonna be okay... And as he leans in and grabs the duffel, A FIGURE appears from behind a parked car, raises a gun. Marcus senses something, bolts with the duffel bag, but... BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! Bullets tear into his body; he contorts, keeps running, tries to grab his own gun, but.. BLAM! BLAM! BLAM! More shots; he collapses to the street, drops the bag, blood gushing from his wounds. And as he loses consciousness, the FIGURE calmly approaches, takes aims at his prone body... BLAM! Another shot rips into Marcus’ jaw. And as the FIGURE grabs the duffel and bolts, Marcus’ blood pools on the street. And as the CAMERA MOVES IN on his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (game show host voice) Hey hey hey! Let’s give a warm welcome back to Marcus Philips!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the sounds of wild APPLAUSE, we‘re back on the set of “Let’s Make a Drug Deal”. The adult Marcus stands with Topeat, who’s now dressed in a white tuxedo.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Marcus, you‘ve made it all the way to our bonus round! We HEAR a series of BELLS, WHISTLES, other SOUND EFFECTS.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: And here’s how it works. You can cash out now and chalk yourself up as another NYPD statistic... Topcat nods toward his lovely game show assistant -~- it’ KATRINA, Marcus’ mom, glowing all in white, standing besi her Buick Regal. She holds a gift box, smiles...

dialogues.speaker: KATRINA
dialogues.text: I got you the Atari, baby.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 93.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: Or you can risk it all and go back to a very uncertain future... Topcat gestures to his other Assistant -- a fat, middle-a NURSE who stands beside a wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: So what’s it gonna be Marcus, door number one or door number two? THE AUDIENCE is again packed with YOUNG BLACK MALES, but unlike before, they’re all bulliet-riddled and bloody -- murder victims, including a laughing, bloody Antwan.

dialogues.speaker: AUDIENCE MEMBER
dialogues.text: Stay here nigga! Who you think you are?

dialogues.speaker: ANTWAN
dialogues.text: Ain’t nothin’ back there for you! BACK TO MARCUS, who stands with Topcat thinking it over.

dialogues.speaker: TOPCAT
dialogues.text: What’s it gonna be, Marcus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Charlene, Grandma, Grandpa and Cameron look on, a DOCT 30s, hovers over Marcus, who’s wrapped like a mummy, jaw wired, tubes and wires protruding everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: (snapping his fingers) Marcus? Marcus. Very slowly, Marcus opens his swollen eyes, tries to focu

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Hey, you're still with us. (beat; off Marcus’ look) You‘re in pretty bad shape and I know you can’t talk, but I want you to try and squeeze my hand, okay? Marcus looks at him blankly. CLOSE ON MARCUS’ FINGERS -- They don’t move. Charlene cri Finally... he squeezes the Doctor‘’s hand.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 94.

dialogues.speaker: GRANDMA CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Thank you Jesus. Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Go back to sleep, you're gonna make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few weeks later. Marcus, thin, weak, legs in a cast, he wrapped, jaw wired, sits in a chair looking out the windo

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In the weeks followin’ the shooting, I did nothin’ but think. With nine bullet holes in me, there wasn’t much I could do. Though my jaw was shattered and I could barely talk, I was still amazingly lucky - whoever Majestic sent to kill me fucked it up pretty good. Charlene, now noticeably pregnant, enters with a malted. She unwraps a straw, holds it to his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Here baby, sip this. The phone RINGS. Charlene crosses and answers.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Hello?... Hold on. (turns to Marcus) Genesis Records? Marcus nods, takes the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: {through wired jaw) Lo? Marcus listens a while, hangs up. Charlene looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: They droppin’ me. Charlene crosses, gives him a hug...  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 95.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: For months after, I refused to see any of my crew -- as their leader I couldn’t afford to let them see me in a compromised position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rural; the middle of nowhere. With Marcus in the passenge seat, Charlene pulls up and parks a beat up Chevy near a small, run-down cottage.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I sold my car, scraped together some cash, then moved us up to a small house in the Poconos. Marcus gets out of the car on crutches - though his jaw i longer wired, he’s extremely thin.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I had lost sixty eight pounds. Charlene reaches into the back of the car, removes a car with an INFANT strapped in.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Aside from Charlene and our new baby Michael, I didn’t have a fuckin’ thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dingy; hardly any furniture. Marcus and Charlene sit at t table eating dinner, the BABY asleep in a crib nearby.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I was in exile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a PHYSICAL THERAPIST guides him, Marcus slowly walks between two parallel bars.

dialogues.speaker: PHYSICAL THERAPIST
dialogues.text: Easy. Use the supports, come on. Marcus frowns, keeps walking. He’s clearly in pain.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 96.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (slurred; stiff jawed) We been doin’ this for weeks.

dialogues.speaker: PHYSICAL THERAPIST
dialogues.text: It may take years, Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dejected Marcus sits watching Jerry Springer. Outside, Charlene pulls up in the Chevy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus limps outside as Charlene takes the baby out of hi car seat. MARCUS. Hey.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Can you take him? Charlene hands Marcus the baby. He winces from the weight

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Ah. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: (grabs the baby) Give him to me. Go back inside. MARCUS. Fuckin’ shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus limps back inside. Charlene follows with the baby a bag of groceries. As they put them away in silence, the phone RINGS. Marcus lets the answering machine pick it up

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: (over answering machine) Marcus, it’s Tony Cash, you there?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: You wanna get that? Marcus shakes his head no.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 97.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: (over answering machine) Just so you know I left Darius, I'm out on my own now. Hit me up, let's talk. The machine cuts off. They continue putting away the groceries in silence. After a while...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: You gonna call him back?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: I dunno. To talk about recording?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Recordin’?! I can barely fuckin’ talk!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: So that’s it then? This is it?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Fuck you talkin’ about?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: This! This place, this life! Is this it for us?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I‘m in fuckin‘ pain, Charlene!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: What about me, you don’t think I'm in pain?!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I almost fuckin’ died!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: And you’re acting like you did! Marcus stops in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: I know you hurt, Marcus, I can’t imagine how bad, but it can’t be worse than what I feel when I see you giving up on yourself. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 98. CHARLENE (cont'd) (several beats; then) You don‘t lose a fight by getting knocked down, baby. You lose by staying down. Marcus looks at her. After a long time, he crosses, puts arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Charlene was right. Everything I ever got was ‘cause I busted my ass to get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing sweats and a T-shirt, Marcus sits on the edge of bed slowing tying his sneakers.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Why should gettin’ better be any different? And as some driving music kicks in, we're in a MONTAGE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus enters the gym. Slowly, he lifts weights, just the bar at first. He grimaces in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus lays on the floor, plays with Michael as Charlene makes dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus stands before the mirror slowly working his jaw muscles, forcing his mouth to form words through the pain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus walks on a treadmill. Lifts weights again -- this time there’s more than just the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaves are changing color. Marcus walks in the yard with Michael, now several months older.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shirt off, Marcus does pull ups; he‘s gaining weight and muscle. We see him on the treadmill -- running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus speaks into a mic, recording himself rapping. He plays it back, seems satisfied with the results.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weeks later. Marcus stands drinking a protein shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus bench presses real weight; he looks like his old s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With snow on the ground, Marcus runs, throwing punches li boxer. And as he nears the house, we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony sits reading the paper. The phone RINGS. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS'S VOICE
dialogues.text: (over telephone) They put Humpty Dumpty back together again. And on Tony’s smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus sits with Tony eating lunch.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: So what’s the plan, man? Whatchu gonna do with yourself?  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 100.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Haven‘t really thought about it.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: You like it up here?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s a-ight. (off Tony’s look) It fuckin’ sucks, okay? Tony laughs, pushes his plate away. TONY CASH. Obviously I didn’t drive all the way up here to talk about real estate. So you got my message I left Darius, right?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: Good guy, different vision. Marcus nods. A few beats, then:

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: I think you should focus on recordin’ again.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: For who? Genesis dropped my ass.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: Fuck Genesis, record for the street. (off Marcus‘ look) Mix tapes, bootlegs, sell ‘em right there on the sidewalk. You got a buzz man, people already know who you are. Fucked as it is, gettin’ shot got you more press than any fuckin’ record deal.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Some fuckin’ publicity stunt.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: I got a studio right in my basement, we can work in private. It‘s quiet, isolated, away from all the bullshit. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 101. TONY CASH (cont'd) You do a record, we drop it, do another, drop that a month later. You’re back from the dead man, your shit‘ll be everywhere. What do you say? And as Marcus mulls his decision:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Much as you hear the term used, there’s no such thing as a gangsta rapper. Truth is you can’t be both, at least not effectively. You're either a gangsta or a rapper and each one requires your full and total dedication. I decided that day to put the thug life behind me -~ I was now a rapper. Marcus looks Tony in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: When do we fuckin' start? And as one of Marcus’ songs kick in... INT. TONY CASH’S HOUSE - STUDIO - DAY A small in-home studio. As Marcus stands in the sound boo rapping into a mic, Tony works the sound board.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Within a week, I started workin’ with Tony night and day. We began with some shit I wrote in the hospital. Over the song Marcus is recording, we see the following:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus poses for a PHOTOGRAPHER, shirt off.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: A month later we had eighteen tracks, made our own independent album. CLICK. The Photographer takes Marcus’ picture, which we s on the cover of a mix tape CD titled “Bulletproof”.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 102.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Since the crack game was what I knew best, I decided to use those same skills in the record business. I was the supplier... INT. TONY CASH‘S HOUSE - BASEMENT ~ DAY Bama sits at a table, inserting CDs into jewel cases.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Bama was in charge of packaging... EXT. TONY CASH’S HOUSE - DAY Keryl and Romeo load cases of “Bulletproof” into the Bron

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And Keryl and Romeo handled distribution...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing shades, dressed sharp, Tyrell leans against a new parked on the corner.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Though I hated to see him go, Tyrell decided he‘d rather take his chances on the street. Within days my shit was all over New York...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keryl and Romeo pull up in the Bronco, park near a sidewa cD stand. And as they unload cases of “Bulletproof”...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Street corners...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dance floor is packed. Bama and Romeo cross the room, hand the DJ a CD. The DJ takes it, nods.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Clubs...  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEENAGERS hang out, Marcus‘ music playing from a boom box

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Parks... Instead of crack, it was now my music floodin’ the city. INT. TONY CASH’S HOUSE - STUDIO - DAY Marcus at the mic; Tony at the board. The Crew looks on.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: As for me, I kept in the studio, doin’ six more records in seven months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a different sidewalk CD stand, we PAN across a row of Marcus Philips bootlegs, all with different covers.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Even still I knew I could do more. INT. MARCUS’ APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT With BET on the television, Charlene serves pizza as Marc Keryl, Tony and Romeo sit around bullshitting. Bama sits the floor playing with the Michael, now a toddler.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What we need’s a record to grab people, get they attention.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Dawg, you all they talkin’ about out there.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: Maybe so, but we're talkin’ about gettin’ to the next level.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Create some controversy.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Thanks, but I think I’ve had more controversy than I can stand.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 104.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You know what I mean. As they ad-lib goodnights, Charlene exits to put Michael bed. On TV, a lame gangsta video plays. Bama watches it.

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: Check these lame~ass niggas.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: That ain’t gangsta.

dialogues.speaker: BAMA
dialogues.text: (to Marcus) You seen more shit in a afternoon than these niggas seen in they whole lives. The guys watch in silence a while, eat their pizza, then:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: KERYL
dialogues.text: What is?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: That’s I’ma sing about, all the shit happened to me.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Pumpin’ crack, gettin’ shot. I’‘1l name names and everything.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: You fuckin’ buggin’?

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: Sure you wanna do that?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Fuck ‘em, what they gonna do? And as the guys look at him:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Far as I’m concerned, if Bama never said nothin’ intelligent ever again, it wouldn‘t matter. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision “09/12/04 105. MARCUS (V.O.) (cont'd) In his own crazy way, he had just given me the idea that would change our lives. Three days after finishing that pizza, I laid down a new track in Tony’s basement.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. TONY CASH’S HOUSE - STUDIO - DAY As Tony works the board, Marcus records a song similar to “Ghetto Q’uaran” appropriate to the movie in which he nam names and talks about real events in his life. As it play

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF SHOTS: At a sidewalk CD stand, Keryl and Rome deliver cases of the new bootleg.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What started as an independent record hit like nothin’ I'd ever done, I mean it spread like a fuckin’ gasoline fire. KIDS in the park hover around a boom box listening in disbelief to the song; a local RADIO DJ holds up the boot talks into the mic; a sidewalk CD Hustler hawks the bootl on the street.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Suddenly everybody was talkin’ about me, and not just fans either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Majestic and Breeze sit in the BMW, listening to the CD. They don’t look happy.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Truth is, I didn’t give a fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron sits at the kitchen table, in mid-conversation wi Marcus, who's sits across from him going over some papers  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 106.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: --.so aside from that, it’s a standard contract. Tony’1l make the rounds, call us from L.A. Marcus nods. He looks up at Cameron, senses something.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What else on your mind?

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: I got a call from the District Attorney's office. They're still investigating the shooting.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (chuckles) Why they waste their time? They know I ain’t gonna testify against fuckin’ Majestic.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: That’s the thing though... they don't think it was him.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Obviously it wasn’t him literally, it was some nigga work for him. Cameron says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Look, this is some really confidential shit, okay?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Stop talkin’ to me like a lawyer, b. What?

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: (leaning in) The Bureau of Prisons has wiretaps in all maximum security facilities, it allows them to monitor high- level prisoners. After you had your problem, told Majestic to fuck off? He called Levar Cahill to get permission to have you killed.  Untitled 50 Cent Project “ 2nd Revision 09/12/04 107.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: So there it is.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: Levar said no. He told ‘em to back off of you and Bama.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What? why?

dialogues.speaker: CAMERON
dialogues.text: I have no idea. On Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Charlene sleeps beside him, Marcus lays awake in bed. After a few beats, he gets up, checks the baby, then exit

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: For days after that conversation, I tried to make sense of this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus sits outside, alone on the porch steps.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: By the code of the street, they had every right to kill me. EXT. LEWISBURG PRISON —- PENNSYLVANIA - PARKING AREA ~- D A large maximum security facility. Marcus pulls up in a B no Bodyguards. He parks, heads toward a guard gate.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Not only couldn‘’t I figure out who shot me -~ I had no fuckin’ idea why Levar wouldn’t allow it. INT. LEWISBURG PRISON - VISTOR‘S AREA - DAY Marcus sits in a booth, telephone on the wall next to him After a few beats, LEVAR CAHILL enters the glassed-in visitor’s area in an orange prison jumpsuit. He takes a seat behind the Plexiglas opposite Marcus. Picks up the phone. Marcus does the same.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 108.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Thanks for seein’ me.

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: Thanks for comin’. Marcus smiles. It’s awkward.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: So how you doin’?

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: Survivin’... See you are too.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... (several beats; then) Listen, I know you can’t really talk... freely, you know, but... I just wanted to thank you.

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: For what? Marcus looks away, doesn't know how to say it.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I did some shit, maybe made some bad mistakes...

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: Stepped on the wrong fuckin’ toes.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: Well just so you know, my boys weren't the niggas bent you up.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I know that... I don’t know who was gunnin’ for me now. Levar nods. A few beats, then:

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: What's this shit I hear, you singin’ now?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Workin’ at it.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 109.

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: Sounds to me like you gotta figure out who the fuck you are, son.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: You know you may not know it, but Mme and your boy Topcat was pretty tight at one time.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Word?

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: Back in the day, came up together right there in your old hood.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Well I know he thought the world of you.

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: (smiles) You got a girl?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS,
dialogues.text: My baby moms.

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: Baby, huh? Got a picture? Marcus takes out his wallet, holds a PHOTO of Michael aga the glass. Levar smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Name‘s Michael.

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: (smiles) Got your mama's eyes. Marcus smiles, nods... then it hits him.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You knew my moms? Levar looks at him.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 110.

dialogues.speaker: LEVAR CAHILL
dialogues.text: Much, much better than you realize. (several beats; then} Take care of yourself. Levar hangs up. He touches his fingers to his lips, then to the Plexiglas. He gets up, crosses off into the prison without looking back. Marcus watches thunderstruck as he processes what he’s just been told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus drives the Chevy, lost in thought...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The whole ride home my mind was racin', it was like my brain was on overload. If Levar was my father, I had to reinterpret everything I knew about myself -- not to mention everything that had happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus cruises the boulevard, checking out the FIENDS and HUSTLERS. He stops at a light, looks across the street wh Junebug makes a sale to Kenneth, the high school bully.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I always assumed it was Junebug bent me up -- God knows the motherfucker had his reasons. But just when I made up my mind for sure... it hit me.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: pulls up next to him in a gleaming new Jaguar, a HOTTIE at his side. Marcus looks at him a beat, then follows discreetly when the light changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrell gets out of the parked Jag, looking like a million bucks. As he opens the passenger door for his GIRLFRIEND.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Tyrell. Tyrell turns around, startled. Marcus is behind him.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 1il.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: Fuck, you fuckin’ scared me, man!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (smiles) Why'd you be scared of me?

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: I didn’t expect you, fuck... How you doin’?! Tyrell hugs him. Marcus is stiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I’m a-ight.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: This is my girl, Lena. Say hi to Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: LENA
dialogues.text: Hello. Marcus just nods. Turns back to Tyrell.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: So how you been, seem like you doin’ real good.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: New car, new crib... Gettin’ your money?

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: (laughs uncomfortably) Tryin’, you know.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: The night of the shooting. Marcus parks his Mercedes, crosses to the trunk. Grabs the duffel. A FIGURE appears, raises a gun.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: Marcus collapses, blood gushing from his wounds. And as h loses consciousness, WE SEE the figure approach and take It’s Tyrell.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 112.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: So you wanna come in for a drink?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Nah, you go. Maybe another time.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: Absolutely, man.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Absolutely. (nods to Lena) Nice meetin’ you. ‘Marcus stands watching as Tyrell and Lena cross off towa his building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus stands with a TRUCKER type, 40s, looking into the trunk of the guy's car.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Later that night, I scraped together whatever money I had left and strapped myself up. Marcus selects a .45 automatic from an open suitcase, tri it out, then pays the Trucker in cash.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Levar was right -- it was time to figure out who the fuck I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus loads the last of several suitcases into the trunk the Chevy, which is packed with moving boxes also. Charle pokes her head out of the cottage's front door.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Marcus, Tony called again.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Fuck it, don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: He left like six messages. He says it‘s important.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 113.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I’1l call him later. INT. GRANDMA‘’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY Grandma fawns over Charlene and Michael as Marcus, Grandp and Uncle Sport carry in boxes.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.Q.)
dialogues.text: That day I moved us back to my Grandma‘s. And though she made us a big dinner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus and Charlene sit at the table with Grandma, Grandp and Michael. Marcus doesn’t touch his food.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ..-food was the last thing on my mind. INT. GRANDMA'S HOUSE - MARCUS’ BEDROOM - NIGHT As the phone RINGS upstairs, Marcus slips the .45 into hi waistband, then slips on a Kevlar vest. A few beats, then

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Marcus, it’s Tony! Marcus frowns. A beat, then he picks up the extension:

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I got it! Charlene clicks off. Marcus talks into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Wassup?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLD RECORDS, photos of MUSICIANS line the wall. Tony Cas sits on a couch talking on his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: Fuck you been? I been callin’ for days.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 114.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I‘m busy, I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: Fuck all that, I got good news. Kaleidoscope heard the mix tapes, they wanna sign you. MARCUS. Fuck it, I’m not interested.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: It's over man, I’m done with that shit.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: Fuck you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: You heard me.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: You realize what you're sayin’ here?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I know exactly what I’m sayin’.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: Look, let’s talk about--
