dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: Marcus, just-- Click. Marcus hangs up on him. INT. GRANDMA’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT On the couch Grandpa plays with Michael as Charlene and Grandma look on. Marcus enters.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 115.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: What’d Tony want?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Nothin’. Business stuff. Marcus starts slipping on his jacket, heads to the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: You’re going out?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I got some shit I gotta take care of.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: But we just got here.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I'll be back in a little while. Charlene approaches, puts her arms around him to kiss him then pulls back...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: You’re wearing your vest?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: It’s nothin’.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: You’re scaring me.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: It’s a-ight, relax. CHARLENE. Marcus, what the hell-- Charlene stops, notices

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: standing behind them. She looks at Marcus, then:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Come say bye to daddy, baby. Michael waddles over in his pajamas. Marcus picks him up.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 116.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Hey little man, you goin’ to bed? You know tomorrow we goin’ to Playland, go on some of them rides, would you like that? Marcus looks at Michael. Suddenly it hits him...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Same foyer. 8-year-old Marcus in pj‘s. Katrina kneels dow

dialogues.speaker: KATRINA
dialogues.text: I‘ll see you Saturday, okay, baby? BACK TO PRESENT. Marcus stands looking at Michael.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: You all right?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yeah. He hands Michael to Charlene.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I gotta go. Michael gives Charlene a quick peck, then exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus drives the Chevy...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There’s an old saying that he who forgets the past is doomed to repeat it. But hard as it was to tear myself away from my son that night, I had to address this shit with Tyrell. And as he pulls off at an exit... EXT. TYRELL’S APARTMENT BUILDING - NIGHT Tyrell exits the building, crosses to his Jag parked on t deserted street. He hits the remote. It BEEPS, then:  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 117.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don’t fuckin’ move. Marcus appears from nowhere, his .45 pressed against Tyre temple. In a flash, he reaches under Tyrell’s jacket, removes his Glock .9mm, pockets it. Tyrell trembles.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: You motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: On your knees. Tyrell drops to his knees, shaking.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: Why you fuckin’ doin’ this, man? I thought we were friends.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: That’s what I fuckin’ thought. At least have the balls to admit what you did.

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Say it! Tell me how you fuckin’ shot me, how you left me for dead, took that fuckin’ money. Tyrell trembles. Marcus presses the barrel of the gun int his forehead. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: TYRELL
dialogues.text: You woulda done the same fuckin’ thing, man! Marcus looks at him, almost smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I coulda done the same thing. Marcus‘ finger starts to tighten on the trigger. Tyrell’s eyes close. Marcus squeezes and... CLICK. The .45 is unloaded. Tyrell looks up at him, practically pissing himself.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 118.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: The streets‘1l take care of you, motherfucker. I‘m done with your ass. As Marcus turns and heads back to the Chevy, we stay with Tyrell, who quietly removes a .380 from an ankle holster.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: In many ways, the question of who we are and what we'll be is determined at birth. Tyrell runs up behind him, gun drawn, aiming...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: For me, the hood was in my blood...

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS SPINS,
dialogues.text: Tyrell’s loaded Glock in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: Marcus nails Tyrell with a shot dead center in the forehe

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But that didn’t mean I had to let it destroy me. Tyrell collapses in a heap on the quiet, deserted street. Marcus looks at him, then gets in the Chevy and pulls awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a duffel slung over his shoulder, Marcus kisses Char and Michael goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: I‘1l cali you when I get there.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLENE
dialogues.text: Be careful, okay?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The next day, I packed up and headed to Los Angeles.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 119.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus sits in the back of a car service sedan, which hea toward the Van Wyck Expressway.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: By some miracle, God really did let me walk out of hell. For all his power, though, it always occurred to me... At a stop light, he looks out the window. Junebug stands the corner, staring at him. They lock eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: He never did figure out how to get rid of the devil. And as the car pulls off, we see Junebug through the back window, still staring. As Marcus turns and looks, Junebug “shoots” him with his index finger and thumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the duffel over his shoulder, Marcus talks on his ce phone as he heads toward the security checkpoint.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah, it’s me. I’m on the three o'clock flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony Cash talks on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: There'll be a car at the airport, it‘ll take you to the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Listen, I got my boys with me, that’s cool, right?

dialogues.speaker: TONY CASH
dialogues.text: Yeah, whatever. Just get your ass out here.  Untitled 50 Cent Project 2nd Revision 09/12/04 120. Marcus clicks off. We PULL BACK to REVEAL Keryl, Bama and Romeo up ahead, already past security. Marcus approaches security conveyor.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Bag. Just like in high school, Marcus places his bag on the conveyor. We play the tension as it goes through the x-ra machine. Finally, the Guard looks at him:

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: (smiles) Have a pleasant flight. And as Marcus crosses through security and disappears wit the Crew into the airport, we... FADE TO BLACK.
